column8: ,4 month work term,We are looking for a passionate and driven individual who will be working alongside the Human Resources Team. In this position, you will be involved in a variety of HR responsibilities and the day to day activities that the department takes on. Through this internship, you will gain human resources experience, which includes drafting and posting job listings, participating in interviews and onboarding new employees, interacting with interns and employees, and working on special projects.","Responsibilities

column1: Provide organizational and administrative support to the Human Resources Department;
Assist the HR representatives in the preparation of employment contracts and various letters.
Contribute to the drafting of templates;
Provide support in the administration of the benefits;
Participate in the recruitment process by screening candidates;
Check references and schedule interviews with candidates;
Participate in organizing special projects, such as fundraising, social activities or other;
Maintain records, as well as the HR databases;
Assist the HR department with other related tasks or projects.","Qualifications
Bachelor's degree student in human resources, industrial relations or a related field; § Superior organizational skills;
Ability to effectively plan and manage priorities;
Excellent analytical and problem solving;
Good team spirit and initiative;
Ability to learn quickly;
Excellent knowledge of French and English, both oral and written;
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).","Targeted Clusters

column1: Position:              Marketing & Sales Co-op Student
Division:               GTA Urban Division
Location:              Toronto/Vaughan, Ontario
Start Date:          January 2022 Start - 4, or 8-month work terms
Who We Are

Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with an over 40-year history of operations across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 7,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.
What We Offer

Mattamy is embarking on a journey to take our experience and leadership as a ""community builder"" to the next level. We have ambitious initiatives to expand and enhance our multi-family mid- and high-rise offerings in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA).  Mattamy's new GTA Urban Division includes the company's current collection of 40 high-rise projects and all multi-family developments within its master-planned communities in the Greater Toronto market and has aggressive growth targets for both the 416 and 905 regions of the GTA. The division will be led by a dedicated, experienced team focused on both growing Mattamy's urban footprint and implementing innovative community design.

As a part of the GTA Urban Marketing and Sales team, the Marketing & Sales Co-op Student will be integral to our success, by having a strong understanding of timelines, budgets, and general operations. The co-op student will support the whole team through every part of the sales journey from acquisition through to final sales and will work very closely with the Sales & Marketing Specialist on the following responsibilities.
Why Mattamy

When you're part of the Mattamy Homes family, your day to day work has an incredible impact on the lives of our customers. Everyone on our team contributes to the unique Mattamy way of helping our customers achieve their dreams of home ownership. What we do takes teamwork, and like family, everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. We're honoured to have received external recognition of our company culture as well. We've been awarded:
Canada's Top 100 Employers for 2020 & 2019
Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020 & 2019
Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2017

At Mattamy Homes, we offer a progressive environment where you can experience exciting possibilities in your career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.
We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.","Accountable for maintenance & coordination of sales materials - brochure, floorplans, handouts, community maps, etc.
Manage digital assets - interactive floorplans, site map, digital community links, renderings, etc
Accountable for maintenance & coordination of incentive sheet, price lists & ACO price lists
Assistance with competitive shopping and value graphs in assigned regions
Maintain schedules, pricing, marketing collateral in shared folders
Creation of weekly ad charts.  Proofreading weekly ads and editorials.
Ensure assigned web pages and social media community pages are up to date, website maintenance.
Manage and responsible for my360, JDE Maintenance & Testing (pricing, deposits, incentives, lot premiums, release lots, etc.)
Brochure inventory management including proofing of new/reprinted brochures
Support Specialist and Managers in managing all new project schedules
Support the Specialist and Managers with new community phases/openings, new sales offices
Ensure sales center and model homes are maintained as per Mattamy standards for presentation
Support sales centre set up, TVs, iPad, Sales/Product/Smart/GeoThermal Displays, Site Plan Table, etc.
Support sales centre(s) in various administrative tasks such as ordering supplies
Assist and attend community events, openings (requires flexibility to work weekends and evenings as required)
Help maintain weekly reports (i.e.). pricing, purchaser by city, web registration, flash reports, etc.)
Liaise with internal departments across divisions, external ad agency and suppliers
Support and learn new software systems (JD Edwards, Site Core, Eloqua, etc.)
Scheduling team meetings as needed
Coming up with new ways for the team to stay organized and on track with deliverables","Must be enrolled in a co-op or internship program
Actively pursuing a degree in Business/Real Estate and/or Marketing or related discipline
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Demonstrated analytical ability and problem-solving skills.
Self-motivated with ability to work well in a team and independently.
Excellent judgment, strategic thinking, and forward planning.
Highly organized and detail oriented.
Ability and willingness to learn and grow professionally.","Targeted Clusters

column1: Department:         Mattamy Ventures, Mattamy Asset Management
Employment Type: 4-Month Co-op Placement
Reports to:            Associate, Smart Home
Who We Are

Mattamy Asset Management is an asset manager focused on building a diversified portfolio of investments across geographies, asset classes and the spectrum of risk and return. Mattamy Asset Management is the parent company of Mattamy Homes Canada and Mattamy Homes U.S., which together comprise the largest privately held homebuilding platform in North America. Mattamy Asset Management is committed to achieving the best-possible long-term risk-adjusted returns for its clients and functioning as a socially responsible corporate citizen.

Our Mattamy Ventures team has a mandate to extend the customer relationship with home buyers and expand into new markets by creating offerings that are both economically attractive and valuable for consumers. Creating new, innovative businesses requires vision and hard work. We hired top talent including former CEOs, ex-MBB consultants and former PE professionals. We are excited to grow our team with the next wave of roles!
What We Offer

As a Co-op Student for the Smart Home group, you will contribute to our mission of delivering the future of smart home & IoT innovations to our customers. You will contribute to all facets of the business, including the evaluation of new community partnership opportunities, proposing recommendations to the executive team, providing input on marketing projects, and assisting with the existing operations of the business. This is a unique opportunity to build an entrepreneurial, innovative new venture with the support of an established PE asset manager. We are committed to investing in your personal and professional growth, including exposure to management and involvement in topics ranging from corporate development and strategy to investment management.
Why Mattamy

When you're part of the Mattamy Homes family, your day to day work has an incredible impact on the lives of our customers. Everyone on our team contributes to the unique Mattamy way of helping our customers achieve their dreams of home ownership. What we do takes teamwork, and like family, everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. We're honoured to have received external recognition of our company culture as well. We've been awarded:
Canada's Top 100 Employers for 2020 & 2019
Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020 & 2019
Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2017

At Mattamy Homes, we offer a progressive environment where you can experience exciting possibilities in your career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.
We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.","Responsibilities
Acquiring in-depth knowledge of IoT devices as they relate to smart home technology and stay on top of the latest trends/developments within the industry
Research and evaluate the viability of new community partnerships
Manage relationships with third-party software and hardware suppliers
Support the full product life cycle, including customer research, go-to-market strategies, and end-to-end operations
Visit sales centres to ensure sales processes are consistent and effective
Prepare and present recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders","What You Bring
Currently enrolled in Business Administration / Commerce or related post-secondary program
Previous related work term experience (e.g., consulting, product management, corporate development, strategy or similar) is highly desirable
Strong research, analysis, organizational, project management, interpersonal and presentation skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Positive attitude, entrepreneurial mindset, and ability to collaborate in a team with a lot of autonomy
Willingness to ""roll-up"" the sleeves and get involved in all aspects of creating a new business","Targeted Clusters

column5: SCI - Business","University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report"

column1: Department:  Mattamy Ventures, Mattamy Asset Management
Employment Type:  4-Month Co-op Placement
Reports to:      Associate, Financial Services
Who We Are

Mattamy Asset Management is an asset manager focused on building a diversified portfolio of investments across geographies, asset classes and the spectrum of risk and return. Mattamy Asset Management is the parent company of Mattamy Homes Canada and Mattamy Homes U.S., which together comprise the largest privately held homebuilding platform in North America. Mattamy Asset Management is committed to achieving the best-possible long-term risk-adjusted returns for its clients and functioning as a socially responsible corporate citizen.

Our Mattamy Ventures team has a mandate to extend the customer relationship with home buyers and expand into new markets by creating offerings that are both economically attractive and valuable for consumers. Creating new, innovative businesses requires vision and hard work. We hired top talent including former CEOs, ex-MBB consultants and former PE professionals. We are excited to grow our team with the next wave of roles!
What We Offer

As a Co-op Student for the Financial Services group, you will contribute to our mission of creating and delivering new consumer offerings. Day-to-day tasks will be focused on researching, designing, and developing early-stage products, and implementing, refining, and scaling those with proven traction. This is a unique opportunity to build an entrepreneurial, innovative new venture with the support and backing of an established PE asset manager. We are committed to investing in your personal and professional growth, including exposure to management and involvement in topics ranging from corporate development and strategy to investment management.
Why Mattamy

When you are part of the Mattamy family, your day-to-day work has an incredible impact. What we do takes teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. Based on the culture we pride ourselves on, we've been recognized with external awards as well. Some of our most recent recognition includes:
Canada's Best Managed Companies for 2020
Canada's Top 100 Employers for 2020 & 2019
Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2021, 2020 & 2019
Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2017

At Mattamy, we're passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important aspects of the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues and communities. We offer a workplace that allows our employees to experience exciting possibilities in their career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.
We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

Mattamy Asset Management is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.","Responsibilities
Research, model, and evaluate the viability of potential financial service offerings
Analyze and recommend alternative product features and program designs
Support the full product life cycle, including customer research, go-to-market planning, and end-to-end operations
Build infrastructure to continuously improve and scale each service after initial launch
Prepare and present recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders","What You Bring
Currently enrolled in Business Administration / Commerce or related post-secondary program
Previous related work experience (e.g., banking, consulting, fintech, investing, real estate, marketing & sales, product development) is highly desirable
Strong research, analysis, project management, financial modelling, marketing, and execution skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Positive attitude, entrepreneurial mindset, and ability to collaborate in a team with a lot of autonomy
Willingness to ""roll up your sleeves"" and get involved in all aspects of creating a new business
Strong undergraduate academic credentials in an analytical discipline
Combination of knowledge and curiosity about financial products, business models, and industry trends","Targeted Clusters

Who We Are

Mattamy Asset Management is an asset manager focused on building a diversified portfolio of investments across geographies, asset classes and the spectrum of risk and return. Mattamy Asset Management is the parent company of Mattamy Homes Canada and Mattamy Homes U.S., which together comprise the largest privately held homebuilding platform in North America. Mattamy Asset Management is committed to achieving the best-possible long-term risk-adjusted returns for its clients and functioning as a socially responsible corporate citizen.

Our Mattamy Ventures team has a mandate to extend the customer relationship with home buyers and expand into new markets by creating offerings that are both economically attractive and valuable for consumers. Creating new, innovative businesses requires vision and hard work. We hired top talent including former CEOs, ex-MBB consultants and former PE professionals. We are excited to grow our team with the next wave of roles!
What We Offer

As a Co-op student in the Renewables group, you will contribute to our mission of providing green energy solutions to our customers. You will evaluate new greenfield infrastructure investment opportunities, propose recommendations to the executive team, lead the implementation and management/monitoring of existing renewable infrastructure assets. This is a unique opportunity to build an entrepreneurial, innovative green new venture with the support of an established PE asset manager. We are committed to investing in your personal and professional growth, including exposure to senior MAM executives and involvement in topics ranging from corporate development and strategy to investment management.
Why Mattamy

When you're part of the Mattamy Homes family, your day to day work has an incredible impact on the lives of our customers. Everyone on our team contributes to the unique Mattamy way of helping our customers achieve their dreams of home ownership. What we do takes teamwork, and like family, everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. We're honoured to have received external recognition of our company culture as well. We've been awarded:
Canada's Top 100 Employers for 2020 & 2019
Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020 & 2019
Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2017

At Mattamy Homes, we offer a progressive environment where you can experience exciting possibilities in your career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.
We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.","Responsibilities
Acquire in-depth knowledge of renewable energy technology with a focus on geothermal and solar energy and stay on top of the latest trends/developments within the industry
Project manage the design, construction, and implementation of new infrastructure assets
Visit sites to ensure proper implementation and ongoing monitoring of renewable infrastructure assets
Select and manage third party vendors including engineers, designers, and contractors
Research, model, and evaluate the viability of renewable greenfield infrastructure opportunities
Prepare and present recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders","What You Bring
Previous related work experience (e.g., mechanical, civil, or electrical engineering, project management, renewable energy/greenfield infrastructure analyst) is highly desirable
Strong research, analysis, project management, and execution skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Positive attitude, entrepreneurial mindset, and ability to collaborate in a team with a lot of autonomy
Willingness to ""roll-up"" the sleeves and get involved in all aspects of developing renewable energy infrastructure
Passion for renewable energy and helping the world transition away from fossil fuels
Strong undergraduate academic credentials in an analytical discipline (e.g., engineering)
Familiarity with the implementation of renewable infrastructure (e.g., solar, geothermal, wind) is considered an asset
As the position will involve travel to construction sites, a class ""G"" license is required","Targeted Clusters

Who We Are

Our Ventures team has a mandate to extend the customer relationship with home buyers and expand into new markets by creating offerings that are both economically attractive, valuable and improve sustainability for consumers. Creating new, innovative businesses requires vision and hard work. The initial ventures include geothermal and other carbon-reduction lines of business, as well as smart-home technology and innovative financial products to support home purchase and ownership. Come join our growing team and play a key role in launching a new consumer brand!

We are committed to investing in your personal and professional growth, including exposure to senior MAM executives and involvement in all aspects of Marketing.

column8: ,4 month work term,"Every day is a case study on ground-breaking advancements in blockchain at Mavennet.""

column1: Imagine blockchain as pervasive in enterprise business as ERP systems.
At Mavennet, that's our vision:

We're working to build that future by delivering secure, interoperable blockchain products and customized blockchain-based solutions for our clients in different industries from financial services to Oil and Gas.
Here's where you come in.
We are looking for a Full Stack developer who will support our senior team, helping our products to be highly attractive and competitive.

You'll be working alongside other engineers and developers, collaborating on developing solutions. Prior experience with blockchain is not required and will not be used to judge potential applicants. Do note that while our products utilize some blockchain components, our main scope of work revolves around building scalable and maintainable web applications.","* Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.
* Collaborate with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch new features.
* Maintain code integrity and organization.
* Build, architect and deploy new features on blockchain powered applications.","Required:

- Experience translating responsive designs from figma/sketch to frontend
- Experience working with RESTful APIs
- Experience working with Node, Typescript/JavaScript (ideally Nest.JS framework).
- Experience working with relational databases.
- Experience creating and maintaining highly testable, scalable, loosely coupled, and easily maintainable applications.
Nice to have:
- Cross-Platform and cross-browser deployment experience
- Experience working with AWS and Docker
- Experience with testing frameworks (Jest/Mocha) and assertion libraries (Chai)
- Experience with cloud development
- Experience with Angular
- Proficiency with Webpack or other front-end automation tools","Targeted Clusters

column1: Job Description Summary
McAfee is hiring an Accessibility Specialist Co-op for Winter 2022.
You will be working on live projects with the Consumer Products team.
This is a remote in Canada role.","About the Role

At McAfee, we're changing the way we deliver products to our consumers and partners by putting the customer at the forefront of everything we do. As an Accessibility Specialist Coop, you will advance how McAfee ideates, builds, improves and measures the accessibility of its consumer products.
Maintain internal guidelines for accessibility design, development, and testing processes, methodology, and tools.
Act as liaison between individual contributors across McAfee and the accessibility research supplier.
Translate accessibility research findings to technical and non-technical audiences including product management, design and development.
Coordinate accessibility training program participation and delivery to ensure learning objectives are met.
Collect and report on accessibility quality metrics","About you
Must be currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program in Human-Computer Interaction, Inclusive Design or equivalent.
Practical knowledge of assistive technologies, testing techniques & tools.
Knowledge of how to incorporate accessible features in web, software and/or mobile applications using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
Excellent analytical, interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.
Relocation assistance is not provided.
Must be authorized to work in Canada without restrictions (no visa) now or in the future.","Targeted Clusters

column1: Job Description Summary

McAfee is hiring a User Experience (UX) Research Intern for Winter 2022. This is a remote Canada role. You will be working on live projects with the Consumer Products team. You will work with the team on UX research on product designs, learn about our design practices and make recommendations on how we can improve.","About the Role

At McAfee, we're changing the way we deliver products to our consumers and partners by putting the customer at the forefront of everything we do. As a User Experience (UX) Research Co-op, you will strategically advance how McAfee ideates, builds, improves and measures its consumer products. Specifically, you will bring the power of empathy and data together to create extraordinary experiences that literally protect the world.
Design and conduct user studies to gauge the perception and usability of new and existing product features.
Make concrete, data-driven recommendations for change based on your findings.
Communicate with team members throughout the process.","About you
Must be currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program
Graduating between May 2022 to December 2022
Relevant work/project experience in an applied research setting including but not limited to integrating user research into product designs and design practices
Knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design
Excellent analytical, interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.
Willingness to learn new tools to do user research
Relocation assistance is not provided","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Company Overview

column1: At McAfee, we strive to enable a world where cybersecurity is so consistent, reliable and effective that it becomes a trusted foundation in our lives like clean air and water.  We believe that no one person, product, or organization can fight cybercrime alone. It's why we rebuilt McAfee around the idea of working together. People working together. Products working together. Organizations and industries working together. Our goal is to spread this collaborative attitude to our customers, partners, even competitors. All uniting to overcome the greatest challenge of the digital age cybercrime - and making the connected world more secure.
Company Culture

Our corporate culture and values are central to McAfee's philosophy. Every day we embrace a more diverse workforce and inclusive environment. We are encouraged to bring your true selves to work. Our wide range of social communities & programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits, all allow our employees to feel valued as people, while enjoying positive and challenging work.
Role Overview:

As a McAfee Product Design Intern, you will work with a Design Lead to gain experience with generating user focused designs on next generation products. Working with different team members within the Consumer User Experience organization including Product Managers, UX Managers, UX Researchers and Engineers.  This is a Winter co-op position, open to remote Canada.","About the Role:
You will create conceptual designs and storyboards that illustrate a vision for the product, and show how a customer will accomplish their goals
You will participate in white boarding sessions, work with other members of the UX team, help identify opportunities for understanding and synergy across projects
You will work with product managers on the road map
You will understand our goals, strategy and requirements
You will sit in on meetings with customers to understand their needs, workflows and pain points","About You:
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's Degree Program
Taken/taking classes related to design, user experience, computer interaction or user interface design
Can present design projects to the hiring team
Experience with Adobe products and Figma or Sketch
Creative and is willing to share creative ideas with the team","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Role Overview

column1: Do you want to protect humanity from cyber threats with beautiful, intuitive, and engaging experiences?  At McAfee, we're changing the way we deliver products to our customers, employees, and partners by putting customer experience (CX) at the forefront of everything we do. We're looking for a talented UI engineering intern to help elevating McAfee's product experience to the next level through building and innovating upon our design system enabling the delight of our customers worldwide.
McAfee is hiring a Frontend Software Developer for Winter 2022. This is a remote Canada role.

As a UI engineering intern for McAfee's Consumer Experience Design Systems, you will play a key role in contributing to the creation and building new design systems for our consumer product portfolio using leading front-end technologies in mobile, web and desktop (React).  You'll work alongside a cross-functional team of inspired designers, developers, researchers and content strategies on this unique opportunity to build McAfee's new design language into a usable experience for hundreds of millions of its users across the global.
Company Overview

From device to cloud, McAfee provides market-leading cybersecurity solutions for both business and consumers. We help businesses orchestrate cyber environments that are truly integrated, where protection, detection, and correction of security threats happen simultaneously. For consumers, McAfee secures your devices against viruses, malware, and other threats, both at home and away. We want to continue to shape the future of cybersecurity by working together to build best in class products and solutions.","About the Role
Design, develop, and test applications in accordance with established standards and best practices.

Work within a strong cross-functional collaborative environment forged between the Design Systems team and the Product, Engineering, Consumer Design, Marketing, Accessibility and Localization teams across all of McAfee
Adhere to high-quality development principles while delivering solutions on-time.","About You
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's Degree Program
Taken/taking classes related to front end development, mobile development, computer interaction or user interface design
Strong leadership and communication skills
Analytical skills, able to tackle problems in a solo or collaborative environment and explain possible solutions to non-technical team members
Interest in learning new technologies fast
Familiar with quick code iterations, failing quickly and retrying","Targeted Clusters

column1: MCAN is a niche-strategic investor in the Canadian real estate market focused on three key areas: single-family mortgages, residential construction loans, and other real estate investments. Our targeted approach to growth reflects our expertise and understanding of the needs of investors, clients, partners and the markets in which we invest.

Our people are our best asset - the kind of people you want on your team: smart, collaborative and helpful with a friendly, positive attitude. We are committed to building the company and building team member capabilities. Do you possess and value the same attributes? Are you interested in your own development? Then come join our team!

The Infrastructure support team covers a full spectrum of hardware and software required to keep the business operational, by providing level 1 and level 2 support. column1: Joining MCAP means you will be a part of our diverse workforce of highly talented individuals who are recognized for their expertise and success! At MCAP, your professional expertise, commitment to teamwork and passion for service excellence are recognized and rewarded with competitive total rewards offering, a career with continuous learning and development (formal & informal training), and exciting opportunities in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment.
The Role

As a Junior Software Engineer, you are the fuel that powers the innovation engine of MCAP's software engineering team, focused on delivering market leading solutions in the Financial Technology sector. We are in the process of engineering for next-generation mortgage lending solutions that demand creativity, innovation, collaboration and a strong desire to learn.  We are seeking a Junior Software Engineer with knowledge in developing high-quality, high-performance distributed systems using RESTful web services and single-page application technologies.","What you'll be doing:
Contributing to the development of microservice-based distributed systems and front-end user interfaces using modern single-page-application technologies

Architecting, designing and engineering web-based software products and components that deliver superior experience - specifically in the engineering of RESTful web services and SPA technologies
Working closely with cross-functional teams through our Engineering Guild to drive innovation, efficiency and continuous improvement across the organization
Performing Research and Development of tools, practices, frameworks, and methodologies to assess their viability and value for adoption to drive continuous improvement
Having fun working as a member of a high-performance team developing innovative and market-changing","What You Bring To The Team
Requirement:
Creativity and problem solving coupled with desire to explore, learn and innovate
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Knowledge of software architecture with specific emphasis on distributed systems, microservices, security, reliability, scalability, and synchronous/asynchronous architectures
Knowledge of RESTful web services and UI components using SPA technologies
Knowledge of test automation tools, frameworks, principles and CI/CD
Our Environment:
Developing in Node.js/Express, JavaScript/Typescript, React using VS Code
Testing with Postman, JMeter, SuperTest, Jest, and Selenium
Deploying with Azure DevOps/Visual Studio Team Services, Git
Using MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Elastic, Docker","Targeted Clusters

System Management

Review possible solutions to resolve identified problems.
Update systems with approved solutions from the business rules.
Understand how to read and maintain the business rules.
Corroborate / validate system solutions, test strategy and results.

Document and Communicate New and Modified Correspondence, Policies and Procedures

column1: ,McMaster University,Department of Biochemistry,1,Open for Applications,Hamilton,Intermediate, Senior",8,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,The Whitney Lab at McMaster's Michael DeGroote Institute for Infectious Disease Research is a multidisciplinary research group focused on the molecular mechanisms of bacterial warfare.  The ability of 'good' bacteria to actively kill pathogenic bacteria influences the composition of important microbial communities such as the human gut microbiome. Our goal is to uncover the molecular details of this process so that we can rationally manipulate complex bacterial populations to improve human health.

column1: The proposed project involves the identification and characterization of new antibacterial toxins involved in competition between bacteria. The successful applicant will gain hands on training in bacterial genetics, protein biochemistry and structural biology. Previous co-op students in this position have gone on to publish their work in peer-reviewed academic journals.","Help manage day-to-day operations
Prepare lab reagents, buffers and growth media
Assist with cloning, protein expression and purification, immunoprecipitation assays, western blotting, bacterial competition assays and protein crystallization
Potential for results to be published in academic journal","Enrolled in an honours BSc program in Biochemistry or related field
Upper-year Co-op students with lab experience will be given preference
Position is for 8 month co-op term only
Positive attitude, works well in teams
Self-motivated, highly organized and detail oriented","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,As part of our QA Test team, the position provides systems testing and team support to ensure that our new product releases work as expected, and satisfy our user's needs.  Our product is a remote dispensing system delivering pharmacy services quickly and efficiently through an integrated self-service pharmacy, mobile & web app, kiosk, and drive-thru solution.  Our users are patients who require prescriptions filled, as well as the pharmacists who fill the prescriptions.  Testing requires an integrated approach, and covers hardware, software, firmware, kiosk user interface, web-based multi-kiosk control, and web & mobile based user applications.","RESPONSIBILITIES

column1: Testing:
Conduct testing during all stages of product development, including integration, regression, verification and validation.
Design, develop and maintain test cases to test targeted areas of product functionality, based on product, development, infrastructure, business and user requirements.
Execute test cases covering the entire system: software, hardware, and mobile and web interfaces.
During test design and execution, analyze both the technical and user requirements, to help identify missing or incorrect requirements as early as possible.
Design and execute manual, automated and performance-based tests at various levels of the system.
Document all defects in the defect tracking system, ensuring accurate and complete reporting of all details required to reproduce the defect and determine the impact on the user and the business.
Actively participate in root cause analysis of defects, including investigative testing. Analyze test data to identify problematic components and user workflows.
Proactively report test progress, results and status, escalating any issues that impact the test or project plans.
Troubleshoot system and environment issues, identify root cause problems, and propose solutions.
Comply with all legal requirements, corporate policies, health and safety guidelines, and basic ethical practices.
Other duties as required by Management.
Teamwork:
Actively participate in Agile methodologies: scrum, sprint planning, demo and retrospective meetings.

Work closely with other departments to provide investigative testing, documentation review and knowledge transfer: Software and Hardware Engineering, Product, Documentation, Infrastructure and Technical Support.

Participate in product definition and design reviews to provide input and recommendations on requirements, functional specifications, product design, feature descriptions, epics, user stories and use cases.  Use this information to assist in test planning, defining schedules and identifying potential problems regarding testability.
Freely exchange ideas for improvement within and between teams.","QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in a Quality Assurance testing role is an asset.
Experience with manual testing an asset.
Candidates with system, hardware, firmware and software testing experience will be preferred.
Understanding of both front-end and back-end web technologies (HTTP, AJAX, XML, JSON and CSS) is an asset.
Test automation (C# Coded UI Tests, Selenium) is an asset.
Test tools - Microsoft Team Foundation Server, Microsoft Test Manager.
Programming Languages - C# and SQL Server.
Operating Systems - Windows 8, Windows 10, Server 2012
Working towards a Bachelor's degree/diploma in Science or a related field.
SOFT SKILLS
Must be able to prioritize and multitask in a fast-paced environment.

column1: ,MedMe Health,Divisional Office,2,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",2,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Are you passionate about transforming healthcare through technology? Do you want to modernize healthcare and make a lasting impact for clinicians, caregivers, and patients alike?

column1: MedMe Health (www.medmehealth.com) is reimagining pharmacy care by transforming the dated retail pharmacy model to one that is proactive, preventative, and personalized. Our practice management software enables pharmacists, for the first time, to intelligently engage with and manage a patient's treatment journey. With virtual consultations, automated follow-ups, and monitoring, pharmacists can deliver adaptive pharmacy care in real-time; better than an in-person visit at a fraction of the time and effort. Over the last year, we've supported the delivery of COVID-19 vaccines across Canada to millions of patients!

We are a Toronto-based, fully remote seed-stage company. We're backed by YCombinator (W21), NEXT Canada, WeFunder in California, Creative Destruction Lab, AC Jumpstart, and was the $100K winner of Velocity's first virtual VFPC.

Our product is rapidly scaling to pharmacies across Canada - we serve 2100+ pharmacies for services like Flu Shots, COVID Testing, and Medication Reviews. To date, over 7 million patients have used our platform to access a clinical service.

For Winter 2022, we're looking for a kickass Software Engineering Co-op - ideally someone with a tremendous growth mindset, passion to make an impact, and ability to wear many hats within a product team. You will be working closely with pharmacists, patients, and business owners alongside our team of dedicated engineers, designers, and entrepreneurs to build and test full features from initial design, to functional release, to user feedback iteration. Given our startup nature, you will have tremendous product autonomy and ownership within your role. We are looking for strong self-starters, project managers, self-learners, and well-rounded communicators.
https://medmehealth.crew.work/jobs","What You Will Do
- Participate in agile development of the MedMe platform along with the rest of the product team, including product managers, designers, front-end developers, and back-end developers
- Lead the development of various features from design to release including MedMe's HIPAA/PIPEDA compliant patient communication tool
- Perform testing/iteration of the MedMe platform through implementation at pilot pharmacies
- Investigate needs for various stakeholder groups (i.e. pharmacists, patients, doctors) and new features to improve the user experience
- Learn, have fun, and put your best foot forward as your role at MedMe will only be limited by your willingness to self-discover new product possibilities and verticals to champion
- Opportunities for tasks related to UX Design, Database Design, Dev Ops, and/or QA depending on your interest","Required
- Previous full-stack experience working in software/product development teams
- Fundamental understanding of Object-Oriented or Functional Programming
- Strong entrepreneurial drive to be part of an industry-disrupting start-up team
- Motivated to learn about the healthcare industry and make an impact through technology
- Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and work well with others
Bonus
- Previous Dev Ops/ QA experience
- Experience launching and scaling real-world customer-facing products
- Proficiency in the following: React, Javascript, Node, GraphQL, PostgreSQL
*Please include your GitHub account in your application.","Targeted Clusters

column1: As a hands-on Full Stack Web Developer you will have a crucial role spearheading this transformation. Working in scrum teams with scrum masters and product managers, the successful candidate will evaluate and, as necessary, transform our organization to ensure that we have the right resources, tools, and operating models in place to add even more value for our customers.","Responsibilities will include:

column1: ,Meter Parts Inc,Divisional Office,2,Open for Applications,Remote in Canada,Intermediate, Senior",17,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About Meter

column1: Meter is a developing next-generation volumetric imaging technology. We are building a machine that can see inside of anything and cloud-based software for processing the complex, volumetric data that the machine produces. Our technology will give engineers, designers, and eventually medical practitioners more confidence in their processes and lower the barrier to high quality imaging and inspection tools.

Our co-op program is a hands-on immersive experience at our headquarters in Cambridge, MA. We make no distinction between full time team members and co-ops at Meter, we provide real world engineering training with students working  alongside our senior engineers. You are part of the team!  Meter offers competitive pay, PTO and sick time and monthly learning and social events.","What will you do?
- Disrupt the multi-billion dollar industrial inspection market
- Define the standards for a totally new class of technology
- Design static and dynamic systems ranging from enclosures to motion stages and everything in between.
- Prototype your designs via in house tools (3D printers, CNC mills, sheet metal forming, etc) or send plans to contract manufacturing partners as needed.
- Build the hardware you designed and run it through a suite of tests you designed to prove functionality
- Analyze the data you gather to make design improvements and determine final go-to-market specifications.
- Compare experimental results from simulation and models
- Communicate your results to the rest of the team on a regular basis
What to expect from us?
- No busywork. Meter interns work side-by-side with the rest of the team to solve real problems, build real features and work on production code that delights our customers.
- Full-stack. No really, full-stack: we build hardware, firmware, back-end and front-end software. You can explore and dig in on a meaningful problem that matters.
- Real teamwork. It doesn't matter if you are a PhD, undergrad or MBA, software, mechanical or business developer, we collaborate to deliver an incredible experience for our customers.
- Mentorship and professional development: Meter has a diverse team. You can learn about work at start-ups, huge companies, grad school and where and how to take the next step.","You:
- Are a well-rounded technical thinker, with a solid foundation in physics, mechanical engineering, and/or electrical engineering
- Exhibit insatiable curiosity for how things work
- Have a passion for puzzles, able to troubleshoot and get to the bottom of complex issues in hardware, software and sometimes a stubborn mix of both
- Are familiar with a variety of sensors, actuators, and electronics
- Can propose new solutions to complex problems and quickly develop functioning prototypes
- Can use code copied from stack overflow, a raspberry pi, and a mess of wires to create a testing setup for hardware systems.
- Understand scientific computing systems (Python, MATLAB) sufficiently to document your work
- Can work independently and collaboratively
- Enjoy collaborating within and across teams
- Quickly learn and apply information in a new field of study at an advanced level
- Like to build hardware and software
- Excel at bringing structure to unstructured problems
- Have conducted research, either experimental or modeling/simulation
- Are comfortable working on a spectrum from theoretical and speculative to practical and established
- Have excellent oral, written and graphical technical communication skills
- Can handle large data sets  with scientific computing in MATLAB, Python, C++, etc.
Bonus points for:
- A portfolio of your past work you can share","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Meter Parts Inc,Divisional Office,4,Open for Applications,Remote in Canada,Intermediate, Senior",22,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About Meter

column1: Meter is a developing next-generation volumetric imaging technology. We are building a machine that can see inside of anything and cloud-based software for processing the complex, volumetric data that the machine produces. Our technology will give engineers, designers, and eventually medical practitioners more confidence in their processes and lower the barrier to high quality imaging and inspection tools.

Our team of engineers includes world-class researchers, industrial designers, PhDs, founders of successful startups, and zero egos. We are backed by some of the top venture capital funds and angel investors in Silicon Valley and beyond. The company is headquartered in Cambridge, MA and has an office in San Francisco, CA.
The Job

Meter is hiring a class of co-ops and interns to work as part of our team of engineers. We make no distinction between full time team members and co-ops at Meter. You'll be working on the same industry defining problems our team of PhDs, industry experts, and startup all stars are tackling on a daily basis. This includes designing, prototyping, implementing for production, and testing throughout our software stack and working on diverse problems spanning computer vision, data engineering, computational geometry, and web-based visualization.","What will you do?
- Disrupt the multi-billion dollar industrial inspection market
- Define and develop technical approaches to data-heavy problems
- Write code to operate everything from embedded electronics to cloud based GPU clusters
- Analyze the data you gather to make design improvements and determine final go-to-market specifications.
- Communicate your results to the rest of the team on a regular basis
- Help inform the development of new hardware and software products
What to expect from us?
- No busywork. Meter interns work side-by-side with the rest of the team to solve real problems, build real features and work on production code that delights our customers.
- Full-stack. No really, full-stack: we build hardware, firmware, back-end and front-end software. You can explore and dig in on a meaningful problem that matters.
- Real teamwork. It doesn't matter if you are a PhD, undergrad or MBA, software, mechanical or business developer, we collaborate to deliver an incredible experience for our customers.
- Mentorship and professional development: Meter has a diverse team. You can learn about work at start-ups, huge companies, grad school and where and how to take the next step.","You:
- Can work independently as well as collaboratively
- Have excellent technical communication skills
- Are familiar with Python, C++, and/or modern JavaScript (React, ES6)
- Are comfortable developing experiments and benchmarking protocols
- Can propose new solutions to complex problems and quickly develop functioning prototypes
- Have a strong grasp of linear algebra and can think computationally about data processing problems
Bonus points for
- Experience modeling physical and optical systems
- Experience in computer vision, imaging, and image processing
- Experience with AWS services (EC2, S3, ECS, Lambdas)
- Familiarity with computational geometry and 3D data types (meshes, voxels, point clouds)
- Familiarity with high performance computing, GPU programming, heterogeneous computing
- Familiarity with machine and deep learning methods
- A portfolio of your past work you can share","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,QA Automation Specialist

column1: About Method:

Method creates web applications for SMBs (small and medium sized businesses). Our flagship product is Method:CRM, a web app made specifically for small businesses using QuickBooks accounting software, and was built entirely using Method's no-code platform. What sets Method apart is its patented accounting synchronization engine, and the capability it provides small businesses to fully personalize it to their unique needs. Method is a fast-growing company with a dynamic team located in the heart of Toronto's entertainment district. We've recently been featured in TechCrunch, Forbes, National Post, Toronto Star, BetaKit and Techvibes, as well as in blogs and tech sites around the world.
Method's platform is so powerful that it has been used by winning teams in the QuickBooks Connect Developer Hackathon two years in a row!
Lots of opportunity - we're a VC-backed startup, with 1000s of paying users - serving the massive market that includes over 30 million small businesses in North America and around the world.
About the Position:
Do you enjoy writing code?
Do you enjoy building apps?
Do you have a 'QA' mindset and a desire to be part of a fast growing team of highly skilled developers?

If you're interested in learning from top product managers, developers and quality analysts then Method is the place for you! The successful candidate will be tasked with projects that are both technically challenging and educationally stimulating. With the help and guidance of our Senior Technical Leads and QA's, the student will be taught practical skills that will increase their exposure and understanding of complex software and applications.","- Creating end-to-end test automation scripts in Katalon for the core applications that Method builds and sells.
- Creating integration test scripts in Python for internal and external APIs.
- Creating load test scripts using JMeter.
- Working closely with Senior QA's on manual regression testing when needed.","- Loves to build products

- Experience with automation tools is an added bonus (Katalon, Selenium, etc)

column1: ,Microchip Technology Inc,Eastern Canada ,1,Open for Applications,Kanata,Intermediate, Senior",3,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.

column1: Microchip's Ottawa team is responsible for creating breakthrough timing technologies, including timing synchronization over packet networks, ultra-low jitter, smart phase locked loops etc.  We design advanced system-on-chip (SOC) devices deploying silicon hardware and firmware for timing applications.

You will have a unique opportunity to work alongside our great hardware/software engineers and learn from the best in designing our next gen world class products.  As part of the software/firmware team at Microchip, you will be directly involved in developing and testing embedded software/firmware for our SoC based products and gain experience with software development process such as Agile and the related tools (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence). In addition, you will also be exposed to different aspects of IC design and development. Part of your duties will include working in our lab using some of our advanced lab setups and equipment.  The position will include in-depth exposure to Microchip's hardware (devices) and companion software releases. You will be expected to work both independently and with other group members.","Qualifications:
* Completion of a 2nd year Electrical Engineering or CompSci/CompEng program
* Excellent problem solving and analytical skills","Desired:
C/C++ Programming and knowledge of Java and database programming
Experience with lab test equipment (oscilloscopes, function generators, etc)
Experience with GNU tool chain ( GCC, GDB, etc. ), makefiles, and scripting languages such as Python, TCL etc.
Knowledge of IP protocols, embedded software programming
Experience with Real Time Operating Systems, including embedded Linux
Excellent communication skills in English","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Microchip Technology Inc,FPGA Business,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Intermediate, Senior",12,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Microchip's FPGA software engineering team develops the Electronic Design Automation (EDA) software used by our customers to program Microchip FPGAs. Customers perform their entire FPGA design flow using our software: from design entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation.

column1: The High-Level Synthesis (HLS) software engineering group develops Microchip's high-level synthesis integrated development environment. High-level synthesis allows our customers to program FPGAs using the C/C++ software language. Customers who program FPGAs using the C/C++ language are significantly more productive because C/C++ has a higher level of abstraction than traditional low-level FPGA languages like Verilog/VHDL. Customers achieve shorter design times, easier verification, and faster time-to-market using high-level synthesis.

As a software engineer intern in the High-Level Synthesis group, you will work on cutting-edge high-level synthesis compiler software with a team of industry-leading experts. You will be joining an agile fast-paced engineering team, where you will solve highly challenging yet interesting software problems.

The software engineering team is based in Toronto. The Microchip office is in the downtown financial core at 67 Yonge Street.","Contribute to our state-of-the-art high-level synthesis compiler to generate high-performance FPGA hardware from a C/C++ algorithmic description.
Our high-level synthesis software is built on the open-source LLVM compiler infrastructure. You will develop and improve LLVM compiler transformation and analysis passes for targeting FPGAs.
Optimize the HLS-generated hardware architecture to improve the quality of the generated hardware circuit (Fmax and area).
Investigate complex real-life customer applications designed with high-level synthesis to optimize performance/area and implement new HLS features as required.
Testing and Quality Assurance on our existing compiler software
Design HLS-optimized libraries for computer vision (OpenCV), math functions, machine learning, and digital signal processing filters.","Required Skills:
Excellent programming skills. Proficient in C/C++.
Knowledge of compilers.
Knowledge of algorithms and data structures.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with the LLVM compiler is a definite plus.
Strong knowledge of digital design and in-depth working experience with FPGAs.
Exposure to high-level synthesis tools.
Experience with Git source code version control.
Experience with shell scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash, TCL).
Comfortable with large-scale software development in both Linux and Windows environments.","Targeted Clusters

column1: Imagine yourself as a Microsoft intern. Join Microsoft today and help us innovate and shape the business of tomorrow.
Are you ready to join us and create the future??Come as you are, do what you love-start your journey with us today!?

We're a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/culture","Product Marketing
Overview

The Product Marketing Manager understands, orchestrates, and influences campaigns and marketing activities, develops integrated marketing campaigns, and delivers product, solutions, and customer campaign feedback to the business. An essential aspect of the role of the Product Marketing Manager is to align the content, timing and delivery of marketing messages and outreach to Microsoft's customers and partners.
Responsibilities:
Manages plans, forecasts, and resource allocation to align with priorities for business performance and marketing return on investments (ROI).
Uses business modeling and long-range financial plans to define the strategy for product stock keeping unit (SKU) and pricing.

Drives product and opportunity value by analyzing market opportunity, segmentation and targeting, value proposition and positioning, through strong partnerships with Customer Market Research and Engineering groups.
Ensures marketing execution, efficacy, and product advocacy by developing integrated marketing plans and driving internal and partner readiness for business return on investment (ROI).
Marketing Communications
Overview

The Marketing Communication Manager embraces our company's Marketing principles, is a Microsoft Brand Steward, and drives ongoing improvements in maximizing marketing spend and driving marketing efficiency, and marketing impact.?
Responsibilities:
Develops and executes marketing communications strategies, plans, and mixes.
Contributes insights towards development of a public relations plan for a product line, service, or local market that is focused on specified influential.
Proposes solutions to or assists in resolution of obstacles that could impact budget, deliverables, or schedule.
Partner/Channel Marketing
Overview:

As a Partner/Channel Marketing Manager you will shape the strategy and manage the execution of programs that drive partner profitability. Partner profitability programs accelerate partner cloud practice development by helping the partners build business plans, develop cloud offers, create go-to-market channels, form new business opportunities, increase partner satisfaction, and strengthen partner loyalty.
Responsibilities:
Determines audience needs, preferences, competitive landscape and behavior along the customer or product lifecycle.
Ensures that marketing plans engage appropriate channel types and capacity to meet business needs.
Implements a part of channel readiness programs that drive sales and technical skills for partners, for successful customer engagement.
Engages with the field to drive program awareness and adoption, and to track engine utilization and effectiveness.","Qualifications
Basic Qualifications
Available for an 8 month consecutive internship starting Jan 2022
Currently pursuing or have completed bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field with at least one quarter/semester remaining to complete after internship.
Demonstrates interest-by the continually evolving craft of marketing.
The ability to deliver results in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.
Ability to manage complex projects with multiple stakeholders.
Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills","Targeted Clusters

column1: Description
Job Summary

The Philadelphia office of Milliman is looking for enthusiastic and qualified candidates to join the Milliman Life practice. The candidate will be assigned to projects in areas including but not limited to Mergers and Acquisitions, Statutory and GAAP valuation, Asset Liability Management and Enterprise Risk Management. We are seeking candidates who will strive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment. The candidate will be a part of a collaborative team of actuarial analysts and consultants ready to share their knowledge and experience.
Mergers & Acquisitions

Milliman is the industry leader in mergers and acquisitions for the last 20 years. Our sophisticated financial models are relied upon to deliver accurate projections and valuations of company assets and liabilities. We are a trusted source of independent analysis on a proposed deal's valuation, merits and weaknesses. In many cases, the deal valuation is only the beginning and we are brought on to consult management on implementation and post-transaction action plans.
About Milliman

Founded in 1947, Milliman is one of the largest actuarial firms with offices around the globe, delivering market-leading services and solutions to clients worldwide. We help companies take on some of the most critical and complex issues, including retirement funding and healthcare financing, risk management and regulatory compliance, data analytics and business transformation.","Job description:
Tasks and responsibilities
Conduct mathematical & statistical analysis for risk management for insurance companies
Develop and utilize actuarial models
Calculate reserves & work on Statutory and GAAP valuations for life insurance companies
Analyze statistical data related to mortality, accident & sickness, disability, termination rates
Summarize results and draft client communications
Assist with research projects","Requirements
Actively pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related field
Successful completion of at least two actuarial exams
Actively pursuing SOA exams toward actuarial certification
Knowledge or training in computer programming languages
Strong analytical, communication (both written and oral), and organizational skills
Self-starter, diligent and detailed-oriented
Preferred skills
Experience with Microsoft Excel, Access and VBA
Python and/or R working experience
SQL and/or SAS knowledge is a plus
MGALFA experience is a plus
This position will be based out of the Milliman office in Wayne, PA.
Education (Preferred)
Bachelors or better in Actuarial Science or related field.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Life Technology Solutions practice at Milliman, Inc. is looking for interns with superior technical skills to deliver a full spectrum of modeling solutions with a primary focus on Integrate® implementations.  Integrate is Milliman's enterprise modeling solution that leverages cloud technology to provide highly automated, scalable, governed, orchestrated modeling processes.  Projects are multi-faceted and fast-paced, so the intern must be team-oriented, client-centric and delivery-focused.

column1: About Milliman's Life Technology Solutions

Today our clients face unprecedented challenges. Actuaries and risk managers are struggling to keep pace using existing, often out-of-date processes. It's a problem that hasn't received sufficient attention but the risk to the bottom line is growing.

Milliman gives insurance companies the insights, the tools, and the expertise to address these challenges, thus helping companies achieve their vision for the future with an entirely new way of approaching the problem. Our portfolio of products and services offers an entirely new way of approaching business challenges because we are thinking differently and leveraging cutting-edge technologies. This focus on continuous innovation is unmatched, and our clients are reaping the benefits.","Typical project responsibilities will include:
Customization of the business logic and actuarial calculations
Configuration of the Integrate solution including assumptions, parameters, workflows, meta-data, reporting, etc.
Development of data management processes to support the end-to-end workflow
Creation of reports, visualizations, analytics, and controls that provide the business consumer with required information from the production process.
Development of implementation specifications and test plans
Creation of validation spreadsheets, regression testing, and other quality assurance activities

Projects are typically delivering modeling solutions that are used for financial reporting or other critical modeling applications.  As such, interns will work within a governed, controlled process. Although the process is controlled, the solutions are often highly creative and innovative - leveraging cutting edge technology and collaborating with Milliman's industry leaders.

Interns must understand the breadth and depth of how the system will be used, making sure the design will support the defined use cases, while also having the flexibility to expand beyond the current needs without major restructuring.

The Intern will develop and apply a broad understanding of insurance and risk modeling applications.  This includes life, annuity, and health products; statutory and GAAP reserve requirements; asset modeling approaches; and risk management techniques.","Required skills and attributes
A passion for modeling and structured modeling process;
Desire to seek, learn, and utilize new system features and/or approaches to improve performance and customer satisfaction;
Strong written and verbal communication skills are required.  Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate technical information;
Creative problem solver;
Strong focus on customer satisfaction and delivery of value;
Exceptional technical aptitude.  Demonstrable ability to quickly gain mastery of new technologies;
Experience with technologies used in an industrial modeling environment, including databases, programming languages, automation tools, etc.;
Insurance product and regulatory knowledge;
Experience developing and maintaining actuarial business logic;
Works effectively as part of a team;
Able to work independently and self-monitor progress;
Proven ability to handle multiple projects and tasks, prioritizing and meeting deadlines;
Successful completion of at least one actuarial exam
Desirable skills
Ability to design and build models for production use;
Knowledge of model performance drivers and optimization;
Experience creating implementation specifications and testing plans;
Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other visualization technologies","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Milliman Inc,Milliman-Chicago,8,Open for Applications,Remote in Canada,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",18,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Chicago office of Milliman Inc. is looking for enthusiastic and qualified candidates to join its Life and Financial Services practice. The candidate will be assigned to work in either the Mergers and Acquisitions or the Financial Risk Management group. The two groups work closely together on mergers and acquisitions projects and other assignments such as risk-based capital impact analysis.

column1: Mergers & Acquisitions

Milliman is the industry leader in merger and acquisitions; we have been either on the seller or buyer side of all major transactions for the last 20 years. When it comes to sorting through the complexities of insurance industry mergers and acquisitions, Milliman offers unparalleled experience. We have been involved in all successful life M&A transactions in the past five years, representing value in excess of $100 billion. Our sophisticated financial models are relied upon to deliver accurate projections and valuations of company assets. Because we never serve as a broker, we are a trusted source of independent analysis on a proposed deal's valuation, merits and weaknesses. In many cases, the deal valuation is only the beginning and we are brought on to consult management on implementation and post-transaction action plans.
Financial Risk Management

We have a focused, multi-disciplinary team of actuaries, financial engineers / capital markets professionals and software developers working together to develop risk management solutions for the financial services industry. We currently advise some of the world's largest insurance companies in areas such as hedging strategy and operations, portfolio risk management, capital requirements, and mergers and acquisitions.
About Milliman

Milliman is among the world's largest providers of actuarial and related products and services. Founded in 1947, Milliman is an independent firm with offices in major cities around the globe. We are owned and managed by our principals - senior consultants whose selection is based on their technical, professional and business achievements. Milliman is the preeminent Life and Financial Services practice in the United States, and we are rapidly establishing our presence in the global market. With more than 60 years of actuarial experience, Milliman's Life and Financial Services practice is well positioned to help clients analyze, understand, and mitigate risk in an era of regulatory change financial uncertainty.","Mergers & Acquisitions
The Mergers and Acquisitions role would potentially be involved in the following type of projects:
Merger and acquisition projects, covering a range of valuation metrics and functions including pricing, modeling, asset liability management, cash flow testing, statutory, tax, and GAAP valuation
Merger and acquisitions due diligence including review of assumptions, risks and operations of the business
Evaluating the appropriateness of modifying product features in reducing a company's risk exposure
Other projects including development of new products for financial services companies, risk-based capital impact analysis and developing economic capital models under various frameworks
Financial Risk Management
The Financial Risk Management role would potentially be involved in the following types of projects:
Designing and executing scalable dynamic hedging programs to manage equity guarantee risk and meet strategic risk management objectives
Pricing and developing new products for financial services companies
Building stochastic models for hedging, GAAP, statutory valuation, and/or appraisals of Variable Annuities and/or Fixed Indexed Annuities business
Merger and acquisitions due diligence including review of assumptions, risks and operations of Variable Annuities and/or Fixed Indexed Annuities business
Evaluating the appropriateness of exotic derivatives in reducing a company's risk exposure
Determining the impact of various risk management programs with respect to M&A transactions","The ideal candidate should have the following experience and attributes:
Completion of at least one Society of Actuaries (SOA) exam and actively pursuing the FSA, FRM or CFA designation
Strong quantitative background with actuarial modeling experience in life insurance, risk management or investments
Understanding of capital markets and modern finance concepts (option pricing, portfolio theory, etc.)
Proficiency in Excel and VBA. Knowledge of SAS, C++, C#, and other programming languages a plus
Experience with MG-ALFA or other actuarial valuation software would be an asset
Ability to analyze and apply creative problem solving both independently and within a team
Excellent project management skills, including communication and time management skills
Self-motivated individual with a sense of intellectual curiosity and a results-oriented work ethic","Targeted Clusters

column1: Milman & Associates Limited is an independent and growing structural engineering company involved in consulting and detailed engineering design services throughout Canada and overseas.

Milman & Associates Limited is called upon consistently for exciting projects that require a high degree of creativity and expertise. Over the years, our firm has lent its professional services to a variety of Industrial, Commercial and Institutional projects.  Some of our clients include: Greater Toronto Airports Authority, City of Toronto, University of Toronto, BELL Canada and Sunnybrook Hospital.

About you:
We require a highly-motivated and creative 3rd or 4th year civil engineering student who is eager to tackle a wide range of structural engineering challenges.

Under the supervision of our Principal and Senior Engineers you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to all aspects of structural engineering from design to construction, making Milman & Associates Limited the ideal place for you to develop the skills necessary for your future career.
What previous co-ops were involved in:
Roof Structure Reinforcement: inspection and analysis of existing roof structure for additional loads. Design of structural reinforcement to increase capacity of existing structure.

Monorail Crane Beam Analysis and Design: structural analysis of monorail beams per Canadian and American Codes. Automation of the process through the development of an Excel program to assist in analysis and documentation.
Machine Foundation Design: dynamic and static structural analysis and design of a new turbine foundation with the aid of finite element analysis software.
Parking Garage Inspection: visual inspection of an 8-storey post-tensioned concrete structure.
Retaining Walls Inspection and Repair Design: visual inspection of various types of soil retaining structures, documentation of deficiencies and design of repairs.
Utility Tunnel Repairs: construction review of repairs to reinforced concrete utility tunnels at Pearson Airport.

Analysis and design of structural steel, reinforced concrete, timber and masonry structures; calculation of loads per National Building Code; developing and drafting structural details in AutoCAD; etc.","As a co-op student you will be a valuable addition to our team, as you will be directly contributing to the success of the firm while at the same time developing the skills and practical experience necessary for a successful career in structural engineering.

column8: ,4 month work term,You will be working on the cutting edge of sonar using machine learning. You will work in a small team to develop an object detection machine learning model trained on side-scan sonar imagery.  This model will be implemented on autonomous surface vessels (ASV) and autonomous underwater vessels (AUV).  You will work from home and have a lot of freedom and responsibility in the project. We want you to have an impact on our team, and we'll give you the tools and training you need to do it.

column1: We are looking for a machine learning engineer to help our team develop a proprietary machine learning network.  Your day-to-day responsibilities will vary depending on the current needs of the development. You may be analyzing sonar data and creating scripts to process it. You may be working on tuning hyperparameters to optimize performance of the deep learning model.  You may be testing and evaluating the model's performance on desktop processors vs low power devices.",#NAME?,"-Excellent deductive reasoning and ability to grasp new topics
-Work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
-Knowledge of numerical methods, data approximation, and linear algebra a plus
-Ability to take responsibility and ownership of a project
-Excellent Python skills
-Tensorflow and/or TensorRT experience
-Embedded/low power device development a plus
-Familiarity with image visualizations
-Data analysis and management experience","Targeted Clusters
