column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,For this round of posting, we have 1 position available for a Winter Co-op student on a 4 month term OR a Co-op student available in the Winter & Spring on an 8 month term. We're open to considering students from all years of study eligible for Co-op.

column1: Development Coordinator
Minto Communities Inc.
Toronto, Ontario
Why join Minto?

We are an award-winning, fully integrated real estate company - proudly creating better places for people to live, work and play for over 60 years. With expertise in home building, construction and property and investment management, we've built over 85,000 new homes, manage 15,000 multi-residential units and carry 2.7 million square feet of commercial space. Our investment management portfolio spans $2.9 billion in assets.

Our business is comprised of four divisions with operations in major cities spanning across Canada and the United States. As we continue to evolve and grow, we believe in hiring the best people who are as committed to creating incredible experiences for our customers as we are. We offer incredible benefits and career growth for our employees including a competitive total rewards package, Minto Learning Centre courses, tuition reimbursement, and flexible summer hours in many locations and much more. Join us to find out how you can be a part of it all!
The Opportunity:

The Development Coordinator is responsible for supporting the Development Team by assisting with the coordination of development applications, investigating potential acquisitions, and researching/tracking relevant policy and industry trends.","What you'll be responsible for day to day:
Support Development Team in day-to-day project management of files at various stages of the development lifecycle, from acquisition through to registration and assumption;

Assist with the submission of complete development approval applications, including Official Plan Amendment, Plan of Subdivision, Zoning By-law Amendment, Site Plan Control, Committee of Adjustment and Condominium applications;
Assist with property acquisitions, including preparation of property research, planning reviews, property roll assessments, and proforma analysis;
Research and review new municipal planning initiatives and policies, Provincial Plan reviews and legislation reform, and guidelines, and coordinate team's involvement in key issues;
Assist in the development of Minto's internal GIS, such as reviewing and updating municipal and regional official plan maps
Conduct site visits and attend key consultation meetings, as required;
Assist in the preparation and verification of market research;
Other duties within the scope, spirit and purpose of the job, as requested by management","Who we're looking for:
Education: Enrolled in a Post-secondary degree in Urban Planning, Real Estate, Civil Engineering, or related field, eligible Co-op student preferred.
Experience: Previous experience in a Co-op placement or internship in real estate, urban planning or development considered an asset.
Specialized Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
Microsoft Office, advanced knowledge of Excel an asset
Knowledge of development process
Knowledge of GIS and mapping tools
Knowledge of AutoCAD and Adobe Acrobat
Negotiation and mediation skills
Team player
Analytical, research and report writing skills
Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills

Minto is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. Should you require accommodation or support in any aspect of our recruitment and selection process, we will work with you to meet your needs.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,About Miovision:

column1: Miovision's mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrow's smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. Backed by the world's most advanced traffic AI, Miovisions innovations in traffic signal planning and operations have made it possible for cities to improve the transportation experience for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians since 2005. With offices in Kitchener, Canada and Cologne, Germany, Miovision serves over 17,000 municipalities worldwide.

As a co-op student at Miovision, you'll work on real projects, solve real problems, and gain feedback along the way from experts in your field. We provide the tools and mentorship you need, and trust you to take ownership over your success. You are part of the team; working alongside brilliant minds to push the boundaries of traffic technology, and directly impact cities all over the world. For more information, visit miovision.com.
Top Reasons to Work with Us
We're builders, entrepreneurs and collaborators who value diverse thinking and backgrounds.

If you enjoy cutting edge technology and architecting solutions to real world problems such as traffic congestion, carbon footprint reduction, pedestrian safety & public infrastructure enablement; then you'll love working on our team.
We offer Training and Development Programs as well as mentorship from A-Players in the industry
Learn and develop your skills whether you are with us as a co-op student, part-time employee or full-time worker
Role Summary:

Miovision is looking for a passionate business student with a keen ability to unite cross functional stakeholders to achieve a common goal. The project coordinator will work in the Project, Compliance, & Enablement (PCE) function at Miovision to help with:
Grant and Funding Inquiries
Software Releases
Partnership & Integration Programs
Manufacturing and Supply Chain Process Improvement
General Administrative tasks with the PCE department","What you'll do:
Organizing, attending, and participating in stakeholder meetings.
Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings.
Providing ad hoc administrative support as needed
Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project and kept up to date (i.e. setting up project dashboards, preparing weekly communications)
Identify funding opportunities through research grants to support both Product and RevOps activities
Assist with the development of grant application packages, info sheets, tracking and monitoring systems, final report templates, and reporting mechanisms
Track inquiries and document ongoing learning and reflections regarding the grants and partnership process
What we're looking for:
Familiarity with Project Management Framework as well as an understanding of Government Funding
Someone eager to learn and grow multifaceted profession
You are a team player and also have excellent communication skills-verbal and written
You are calm in a storm, and can multi-task and organize activities against changing priorities
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information
Proficient G-Suite (Sheets, Calendar, Docs)","Experience We Like:
Creativity in solving problems
Must be well organized with good time management skills
Must work well independently and as part of a cross-functional team
Must be able to work on multiple tasks and/or projects at any given time
Tools we use:
JIRA for Software Development Tracking
SmartSheet for Project Management Tracking
Salesforce for Sales and Pipeline Tracking
Draw.io & Whimsical for Process Mapping
Productboard for Product Management Centralization
Confluence for Document Management
G-Suite for General Office Support","Targeted Clusters

What you'll do:

Learn and develop your skills whether you are with us as a co-op student, part-time employee or full time worker","Miovision is looking for a software developer to help build our DataLink web application to help improve traffic congestion by providing tools required to do traffic project analysis and manage traffic studies. For more information about the DataLink product visit https://miovision.com/datalink/portal/.

The goal of our data platform is to connect our end users in real time with their data and video and provide additional insights and visualizations. As such, you'll be involved in building both front end interfaces and backend data processing to help share our traffic data with users around the world.

Our current technical stack includes: Ruby on Rails 5.1, HTML5, Bootstrap 3, Jquery, MySQL and Redis. The application is run on AWS EKS (Kubernetes). Working with the DataLink team, coop students can expect:
Work in an Agile Scrum environment with a welcoming, supportive, and highly skilled team that ships innovative software regularly to our global customers
Work with team to deliver incremental value to our customers
Mentorship by a DataLink team member
Release regularly to both internal and external customers
Participate in code reviews
Identify technical requirements
Write high quality, maintainable code
Continually improve and learn new technologies
Potential Projects:
Migrate existing features/develop new features to new Angular app
Build a microservice running in Kubernetes
Break out and convert an existing feature from Ruby on Rails codebase or add all new features.
Kubernetes, Docker, NodeJS or Kotlin
Implement telemetry events and collaborate with the data science team to build charts and dashboards based on DataLink telemetry.","Experience we must have:
Strong programming skills with at least one programming language. (Ruby not required)
A visible track record in or out of school, github projects, personal website, strong transcript, etc.
Knowledge of common software patterns
You can convey your design ideas clearly using online tools and don't hesitate to bring your ideas or ask for help from your team
You can break down complicated problems into smaller, simpler problem
Experience that will help you stand out
Experience with JavaScript, Ruby, AWS, HTML5, Angular
Experience with a MVC framework
Knowing good design trade-offs, and long-term impact of immediate decisions
Experience with scalability and performance as a concern
Experience writing unit tests or using test driven development","Targeted Clusters

Right now, cities are forced to make technology choices that stifle innovation. When innovation suffers, so do citizens. Congestion, noise pollution, air pollution, safety risks - these are all things that impact our quality of life. Miovision is committed to breaking this cycle and giving cities the tools they need to be smart cities. When you see the work we do, you will want to live in Miovision powered city.","Miovision is looking for a Business Development Representative to support our Traffic Engineering Sales team. In this role, you'll work closely with marketing and sales to help qualify, convert, and build pipeline. You'll be passionate about starting conversations with cities, engineering and data collection firms and helping them solve today's problems while setting them up to build the smart cities of tomorrow.
At completion of your term, you will:
Understand what it is like to work in a fast pace technology environment
Have valuable and transferable experience in early stage sales processes
Become proficient in leading sales/marketing tools, including Salesforce/MarketingCloud/LinkedIn/Confluence/Slack
Have mentoring and coaching from world class sales and marketing executives
Have experience in creating/running/supporting various marketing campaigns
Grow your professional network within the largest tech community in Ontario","In this role, you will:
Own the MQL to SQL customer journey
Qualify, convert, triage, and disqualify inbound leads
Work hand-in-hand with our sales team to pass along all qualified leads and share all relevant details
Work with Sales Operations in quantifying the value of pipeline being converted
Help generate more high-quality leads through outbound activities, including:
Creating targeted call/email lists
Scheduling meetings and calls for sales reps with qualified leads
Driving attendance to high profile webinars
Driving attendance to exclusive Miovision events
Searching for open RFP opportunities that align with Miovision solutions
To be successful in this role, you should:
Have the ability to lead a discovery process by asking probing questions, preempting resistance, and communicating a compelling business case
Be interested in technology and the ability to learn new technologies quickly
Possess the confidence to be completely comfortable cold calling and communicating the value of Miovision to brand new prospects

You are part of the team; working alongside brilliant minds to push the boundaries of traffic technology, and directly impact cities all over the world. For more information, visit www.miovision.com.
Top Reasons to Work with Us
We're builders, entrepreneurs and collaborators who value diverse thinking and backgrounds.

If you enjoy cutting edge technology and architecting solutions to real world problems such as traffic congestion, carbon footprint reduction, pedestrian safety & public infrastructure enablement; then you'll love working on our team.
We offer Training and Development Programs as well as mentorship from A-Players in the industry
Learn and develop your skills whether you are with us as a co-op student, part-time employee or full time worker

The atmosphere at Miovision is casual and friendly, when it's safe to do so, we provide subsidized lunch vendors and snacks as well as a dog-friendly office","Miovision is looking for an exceptional Hardware Quality & Mechanical Co-op Student with a strong analytical background and hands-on skills to help us build rock-solid devices. You are passionate about driving quality activities to ensure best in class hardware solutions. In this role, you will be involved with testing NPI prototypes, developing solutions for quality/reliability issues, working on test fixture designs and assisting with certification testing activities. Because the team is small, we value practical problem solving and taking initiative to ensure that we're building the right product.

We celebrate successes and build team dynamics through everyday interactions, lunches, and social events. In the past, we've solved puzzles in escape rooms, enjoyed axe throwing, and basked in the sun on the patio together. Come help us solve traffic problems together, and have fun while doing so!
What you'll do:
Develop and execute electrical, mechanical, and environmental test plans for new hardware
Debug and identify fixes for issues occurring during prototype production testing
Support mechanical design team in design of new products and test fixtures
Support manufacturing team in resolving quality issues on the production line & driving continuous improvement projects
Monitor quality KPIs and identify areas of focus
Design and develop manufacturing test fixtures
Root cause design defects
Assist with certification testing for new products
Work with suppliers to ensure quality product is being provided to Miovision
Work closely with Operations and Manufacturing to perform quality analysis on third party parts and triage","Required Skills:
Completed 2nd or 3rd year Mechanical or Mechatronics Engineering
Past experience with electronic design & debug
Proficiency in Solidworks
Strong knowledge of electrical or mechanical systems, or both
Experience in running root cause analysis and sustainability processes
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Very detailed oriented personality
Methodical problem solving approach
Interest in learning and applying skills to a wide range of technical applications
Additional Assets:
Electrical or mechanical design experience
Experience with environmental test specifications and methodologies
Experience with test automation systems
Experience with Altium
Portfolio of past design projects","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,About Miovision:

column1: Miovision's mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrow's smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. Backed by the world's most advanced traffic AI, Miovisions innovations in traffic signal planning and operations have made it possible for cities to improve the transportation experience for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians since 2005. With offices in Kitchener, Canada and Cologne, Germany, Miovision serves over 17,000 municipalities worldwide.

As a co-op student at Miovision, you'll work on real projects, solve real problems, and gain feedback along the way from experts in your field. We provide the tools and mentorship you need, and trust you to take ownership over your success. You are part of the team; working alongside brilliant minds to push the boundaries of traffic technology, and directly impact cities all over the world. For more information, visit miovision.com.
Top Reasons to Work with Us
We're builders, entrepreneurs and collaborators who value diverse thinking and backgrounds.
If you enjoy working on marketing programs across digital, social, events and content marketing, you'll enjoy working with our outstanding marketing team.
Our B2B and B2G marketing environment provides a huge challenge to design, develop and manage campaigns and programs that drive leads and revenue for the company. Become part of a successful team!
Learn and develop your skills whether you are with us as a co-op student, part-time employee or full-time worker","Role Summary:

Miovision is looking for an intermediate marketing coordinator to help us design, develop and execute on marketing programs across all channels. Your primary focus will be on assisting our campaign managers and marketing operations manager in launching, measuring, and reporting on a number of campaigns throughout your co-op term.
What you'll do:
Contribute to the maintenance of marketing technologies to support marketing efforts (50%).  Working in partnership with Marketing Operations Manager to support processes and programs related to:
Campaign set up and reporting
Lead scoring and grading
Marketing attribution set up and reporting
Lead and funnel reporting
Website traffic analytics and reporting
CRM tools (Marketing Cloud, Salesforce)
Reporting tools (Jira, Google Analytics)
Executing and supporting campaigns globally (35%):
Contributing to paid media initiatives & working with Digital Marketing Manager to coordinate media programs
Contributing to campaign development and coordinating work between Marketing Campaign Manager and external marketing agencies
Social media marketing (10%): Maintaining social calendar and keeping up to date with corporate comms,  campaigns, ABM strategies, supporting internal teams.
Coordinate social media posting on company's social channels.
What we're looking for:
Strong communication skills to manage internal and external relationships effectively
Strong Analytical Skills. Takes a data driven approach to ensure successful execution of programs and campaigns.
Project management skills
Experience in Marketing Automation technologies (CRM, Salesforce, etc.)
Experience in Google Analytics, Google DataStudio, Google Search Console
Experience with Marketing Dashboards and Reporting
Proven skills in the use of advertising platforms including Google Adwords, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and others","Experience We Like:
2-3 years of marketing program coordination or development
Experience working on website and social media campaigns
Experience running digital advertising campaigns.
Experience working with a variety of team members in a dynamic environment with multiple overlapping projects and deadlines.","Targeted Clusters

column1: Miovision's mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrow's smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. We are driven to create cutting edge technology and architect solutions to real world problems such as traffic congestion, carbon footprint reduction, pedestrian safety, and public infrastructure enablement

We offer Training and Development Programs as well as mentorship from A-Players in the industry","We are looking for a software developer to help build our industry leading  trafficdataonline.com (TDO) web application. You will be working on the web platform that is the entrance to Miovision's platform.

TDO's goal is to provide a seamless end-to-end experience for customers to turn video into traffic data. This means that you will be developing production quality code that impacts millions of drivers, cyclists, and pedestrians worldwide. You'll gain experience and insight into how we scale and manage thousands of hours a video per day and turn that around into data that our customers can use to turn into insights and data that can be used for engineering analysis.
Our current technical stack includes: C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, all hosted in AWS
What you'll do:
Work in an Agile environment with a welcoming, supportive, and highly skilled team that ships innovative software regularly to our global customers
Release regularly to both internal and external customers
Participate in code reviews
Identify technical requirements
Write high quality, maintainable code
Continually improve and learn new technologies
Potential Projects:
Build a service layer between controllers and the database to handle business logic in a streamlined way
Build a feature end-to-end from web UI all the way through to the database
Enhance our automation posture by writing infrastructure as code for one-click provisioning of environments or deployments","Required Skills:

column1: ,Mission Control Space Services,Ottawa Office,1,Open for Applications,Ottawa,Intermediate, Senior",2,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About Us

column1: Mission Control is a space exploration and robotics company focused on mission operations, onboard autonomy and artificial intelligence. From embedded onboard guidance, to navigation and control algorithms, our technology improves the safety, efficiency and productivity, and science return of robotics missions. Mission Control specializes in software for operating robotic assets deployed in harsh and remote environments like Mars or the Moon, as well as here on Earth.  Our software centers on live accessibility - the key to democratizing space exploration.  We believe in sustainable exploration and are committed to inspiring the next generation to always keep exploring.
Please visit our website to learn more about our team and ongoing projects: https://missioncontrolspaceservices.com.

Mission Control has a clear vision: to be a workplace where a diverse and thoughtful mix of talented people want to learn and do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are priorities for our company, and we believe in creating a team that reflects these foundational principles.
About the Job: ""Robotics/Software Engineering Student""

Mission Control is seeking a student for co-op placement for the winter 2022 work term. As a young company at the intersection of technology development and the flourishing NewSpace market, we are looking for candidates who are passionate about AI/Machine Learning, Space Exploration and Robotics. As part of the team, you will be exposed to a wide variety of tasks, so applicants must be self-starters, unafraid of learning something new and have demonstrated experience in solving complex problems.","Job Responsibilities
Under the guidance of a senior or junior engineer, your primary responsibilities could include:
Participating in requirements analysis, software design and implementation for mobile robotic applications (C++, TypeScript, Linux, Git);
Implementing computer vision and machine learning algorithms;
Developing user interfaces;
Supporting rover analogue mission operations;
Supporting space science activities;
Supporting lab and field testing activities;
Maintaining test facilities and supporting customer testing activities;
Contributing to our office culture with a positive and start-up oriented attitude - we have a collegiate team with a wide range of hobbies and interests.
Additional tasks may include:
Developing state estimator and control algorithms for mobile robot without GPS in unstructured environments;
Validating algorithms in real time on a mobile robotic platform;
Installing and troubleshooting sensor hardware (e.g. stereo cameras, IMU, LiDAR) on mobile robotic platform);
Developing and proposing concepts to potential customers;
Conducting research and development in a wide range of areas, with an emphasis on AI/machine learning, space science, robotics and space exploration;
Some travel may be required.","Required:
Currently completing degree in engineering, computer science or related discipline;
Bonus points for:
Experience or demonstrated interest in machine vision;
Experience or demonstrated interest in hardware interfaces;
Experience or demonstrated interest in embedded systems;
Past hands-on experience or demonstrated interest in mobile robots (hardware and/or software, both is ideal);
Experience or demonstrated interest in orbital dynamics;
Experience or demonstrated interest in spacecraft design;
Demonstrated interest or engagement in space industry;
Telling us why NASA's Spirit rover's mission ended and what could have been done differently to extend its life.
Please apply only if you are eligible for obtaining security clearance in Canada.","Targeted Clusters

Assists Plant Engineer and Plant Superintendent in maintaining the BRC Food Safety Program.

Assists Plant Engineer, Plant Superintendent and Plant workers in preparing documents and labels for all incoming materials and outgoing customer shipments.
Product Development:
Assists Plant Engineer, Plant Superintendent, Management and/or Sales in conducting product development research, evaluation and trials for new and/or existing products.
Assists Plant Engineer, Plant Superintendent, Management and/or Sales in determining best course of action for new and/or existing products.
General Warehouse & Plant Work:
Assists Plant Engineer, Plant Superintendent and Plant workers in completing basic tasks in the warehouse and production areas as required. Warehouse and plant work includes:
-           Preparing and fulfilling customer orders (lifting up to 50 lbs. required)
-           Fulfilling inventory requests (lifting up to 50 lbs. required)

column1: ,MNP LLP,Ontario,5,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior,18,

column8: ,4 month work term,IT STARTS HERE

column1: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different - it's our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It's the same drive that's helped us become Canada's fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to provide you with the coaching, mentoring and feedback required to launch your career.

Be part of the momentum. We are currently seeking a Co-op CPA Articling Student for our Assurance and Accounting - Private Enterprise to start with us in January 2022. Delivering quality in everything we do, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our Assurance and Accounting team is committed to providing meaningful and reliable financial information that ensures our clients are always well protected and positioned.","Responsibilities
Develop technical skills in areas such as: compilations, reviews, audits, bookkeeping and tax
Develop and apply knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and/or Accounting Standards for Private Enterprise (ASPE)
Obtain and review documents from third party sources for audit process
Set-up files for new clients and newly incorporated businesses, manage multiple files simultaneously and conduct inventory counts
Collaborate with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines
Perform accounts receivable, accounts payable, capital asset acquisition and disposition and payroll walk-through with the client in a professional manner
Summarize current financial status by collecting information and preparing balance sheet, profit and loss statements and other relevant reports
Assess appropriateness of audit evidence for expenses, revenues, capital asset additions, accounts payable, accounts receivable and prepaid expenses
Review, investigate and correct discrepancies and irregularities in financial entries, documents and reports
Establish charts of accounts and prepare entries for posting to accounts
Prepare correspondence, technical reports, client summaries and presentations outlining findings, facts and highlights resulting from the client engagement
Develop a thorough understanding of MNP's services, businesses and industry through experiential learning with clients
Liaise and correspond professionally with clients, colleagues and the firm leadership team
Learn about clients' key financial systems and how to analyze risk
Analyze client financial reporting for accurate and appropriate recording of revenues and expenses
Raise identified client issues that need to be addressed with managers and engagement partners
Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes while effectively using MNP internal programs and systems
Raise awareness of MNP through discussions at community events including client and company sponsored functions
Attend internal MNP courses to further develop accounting and assurance knowledge","Skills and Experience
Working towards a Bachelor's Degree in Commerce or Business Administration (Accounting or Finance major preferred)
Working towards all necessary prerequisites for admission into the Chartered Professional Accountants (CPA) Professional Education Program (PEP)
Enrolled in the Co-op program at your post-secondary institution
Previous accounting related office experience is an asset
Customer service and/or client service experience is desirable
Experience working with, or exposure to, accounting and tax software such as Caseware, Profile, Quickbooks and Simply Accounting is beneficial
Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Some travel may be required","Targeted Clusters

column5: ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting","University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,You Want to Work Here!

column1: Are you looking to work for one of the fastest growing technology companies in the automotive industry? Are you located in London, ON and looking for a remote position? Are you looking to work for a company that values their employees by providing a fantastic and flexible company culture? If you are looking for a challenge and an opportunity to grow with an amazing team of people, Mobials wants to hear from you!
Software Developer Co-op/Intern

The Software Developer Intern role is focused on learning, developing, and maintaining our internal software systems. You will actively contribute to the Technology team by participating in code reviews, testing, debugging and documentation. You will develop feature requests and work closely with members of several groups across the business to effectively meet project requirements. You possess strong communication and problem-solving skills. If you consider yourself a creative self-starter with a passion for continuous learning, then this opportunity is for you!","Responsibilities
Write efficient code to maintain and improve the performance of our existing software systems.
Develop, implement, and test small-medium sized feature requests and participate in product feature discovery.
Perform automated testing to ensure proper functionality of our software systems.
Participate in code reviews and conduct testing to ensure software is of the highest quality.
Detect bugs or errors within code and apply fixes in an efficient manner.
Work to achieve sprint targets against fixed deadlines, changing requirements and/or priorities.
Participate in daily team stand-ups, report on progress and setbacks, and openly accept guidance or mentorship from Intermediate and Senior Software Developers.
Work within an Agile environment and collaborate with multiple business groups including Product Management, Sales, and Customer Success.
Research and share valuable findings of emerging technologies and industry best practices with the Technology team.
Document and maintain software functionality.
Fulfill developer and deployment documentation requirements.","Qualifications
Studying at a Canadian post-secondary institution with a focus on Computer Science, Engineering, or Technology.
Knowledge of Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP, Node or Python is considered an asset.
Self-motivated with an eagerness to learn and develop new skills.
Strong oral, written communication and problem-solving skills.
Highly receptive to feedback and mentoring.
Detail-oriented, curious, and asks a lot of questions.
Testing and debugging experience is an asset, but not required.
Who We are Looking For
You are not scared to ask questions, rather, you are always wanting to learn.
Curious learners = creativity = innovation = positive change.
Great attention to detail.
You like to work with a team.
You are not scared to offer your opinion. We value diversity of thought.
You take great pride in yourself and your work … you are a fan of you!","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Molex, a subsidiary of Koch Industries, is a globally recognized provider of electronic solutions in a wide range of industries, including data communications, consumer electronics, industrial, automotive, commercial vehicle, and medical. At Molex, we are continually striving to improve and grow both personally and professionally.

column1: The Molex Industrial Automation group designs and develops a wide array of innovative automation and connectivity solutions engineered for superior performance in industrial environments. Our Waterloo location is focused on Industrial Communication products, for networks such as DeviceNet, PROFIBUS, EtherNet/IP, and PROFINET, including: network interface cards, modules, and remote modules; network gateways; PLC communication modules; network diagnostics and software tools; and I/O modules.

Molex, a subsidiary of Koch Industries, is a globally recognized provider of electronic solutions in a wide range of industries, including data communications, consumer electronics, industrial, automotive, commercial vehicle, and medical. Through our collaborative process, we take a multi-dimensional approach that brings together engineers, product designers, and manufacturing to ensure the design cycle is smooth and seamless. We have design and manufacturing facilities around the world, with an expert team of problem-solvers who work across borders to help bring our customers vision to life. With more than 75 years of experience, we lead the industry in R&D investment, striving to develop and deliver innovative, high-quality, reliable solutions. Visit us in the ""Products / Automation / Industrial Communication and Control"" section of the Molex website (www.molex.com).

Students majoring in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering. May be involved in all aspects of embedded systems development, including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing and documentation.

column1: As a key member of the Monogram (formerly Palette) software team, you are responsible for identifying software issues that affect the customer experience and manage the process to help fix them.

You help with project management by prioritizing issues, assigning tasks, and creating test plans. Your role is vital to delivering the best hardware and software experience to our customers.

You will also be a key member of a tight knit team and get an insider look at my aspects of the company... from marketing to manufacturing. You will also be immersed in the technology startup environment and contribute to the company's growth as it launches a brand new product in 2020.","RESPONSIBILITIES

column8: ,2 work term commitment preferred,Our Company

column1: Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com.

Moody's Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools supporting our clients' growth, efficiency and risk management objectives. On March 1, 2016 GGY Inc., based in Toronto, Ontario, and its AXIS Actuarial System became part of Moody's Analytics.
Our Product

AXIS is a single comprehensive actuarial software solution for modeling of insurance and annuity products with unparalleled flexibility. It is widely used by life insurers, reinsurers, and consulting firms around the globe for pricing, reserving, asset and liability management (ALM), financial modeling, capital calculations, and hedging. Training, documentation, full-time client support and ongoing enhancements are included as intrinsic parts of the system.","Job Description

column8: ,4 month work term,Reporting to the Senior Manager, Technology Operations & Security, the role of all Infrastructure Analysts (1,2,3) is to ensure the stability, integrity, and efficient operations of all information systems that support organizational functions.

column1: In the case of the Infrastructure Analyst 1 role, this is achieved by proactively monitoring, maintaining, supporting and optimizing all workstation class infrastructure (desktops, laptops, industrial PCs, thin clients) and peripheral components (telecom, MFP, computer interfacing purpose-built tools).  The purview of the Infrastructure Analyst 1 role includes ensuring physical stability, logical stability, and basic networking stability of the aforementioned workstations and peripherals.  He or she will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues in order to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments.","Essential Responsibilities / Specific Duties:
Strategy & Planning
Collaborate with greater technical operations team to convey trending issues and top categories of impairment to aid in developing strategic plans for their respective eradication.
Work with team members, decision makers, and stakeholders to define business requirements and systems goals, and to identify and resolve business systems issues.
Asset Management
Ensure accuracy of hardware and software asset listings of all systems within the Mother Parkers purview using defined best practices.
Engage in change management practices wherein hardware/software/process requests do not align with existing and documented current practices.
Security Management
Ensure smooth and timely execution of hire/retire processes.
Provide, modify and remove (as required) security privilege and distribution group access to end users as change control practices authorize.
Monitor and escalate malware/virus/phishing compromises to high analyst tiers for mitigation and remediation.
Operational Management
Provide a customer service experience to those requesting support that is founded in a paradigm of honesty, efficiency, empathy, and strategic vision.
Create and maintain documentation as it relates to system configuration, mapping, processes, and service records.

Ensure operational efficiency of virtual machine based workstations.  Interact with higher tier analysts to ensure that VMs are adequately configured with system-wide services and are adequately configured to support processing needs.
Utilize a rudimentary knowledge of networking to aid in troubleshooting end user device connectivity issues.
Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house desktop, laptop, industrial and mobile computing and communications systems.
Ensure functionality of MP computing peripherals including printers, labelers, scanners, etc.
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems.
Install, set up, and support all hardware and software operating systems for end user systems.

Provide 1st level support for PC level user helpdesk issues.  Create tickets based on customer input then close ticket through issue resolution by using root cause problem solving techniques in tandem with technical expertise.  Should the issue require escalation to solve, engage a Level 2 analyst for support ? together resolve issue to ensure knowledge transfer.
Participate in after-hours support
Perform tasks that may be outside of the scope of the above as defined by the manager or director","Enrolled in Technical College/University in Computer Science discipline
working knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory services with emphasis on administration.
working knowledge of VMWare software

column8: ,4 month work term,Hi, I'm Ben, Senior Product Manager at Moves. I am on the lookout for a Product Management Intern to join our team and help us collect user data to build new features and further enhance our product, Moves, for a co-op position for 4 months as part of a Canadian University or College program starting in January 2022.

column1: About Moves

Moves is a platform focused on solving problems that no other organization can solve. We're addressing the underbanked and underserved market of independent workers in the gig economy.  As a fast-growing segment of the labor market, independent workers are critical to our economy, yet are overlooked by banks. These are the rideshare drivers, food couriers, designers, photographers, consultants, and other freelancers who are finding their next gig online. Moves has developed a proprietary alternative to traditional credit checks used by big banks, by leveraging open APIs and blockchain technology. Moves is building a future of financial services that respects the increasingly independent way people choose to make a living.

Our products are designed to get to know our customers better over time and help them establish a new financial reputation. Moves' affordable products are designed specifically for independent workers in the gig economy, and our product offerings will be expanding to continue supporting their progress and mobility.","About the Role

As a Product Intern, you will play an important role in contributing to improving efficiency and speed of product discovery & delivery feedback loops to the product, growth, design and engineering teams!
As an intern at Moves you will:
Lead projects related to product discovery efforts (e.g. organizing user interviews with gig workers IRL and online, coordinating market research of leading fintech / community consumer applications)
Lead projects related to product delivery efforts (e.g. owning our Business Weekly Report)
Bring an enthusiastic ""can do"" attitude
What we're looking for:
You have a STEM background, and are currently enrolled in similar program
You are approaching graduation
You want to work in a smaller company, having a large impact
You have competency in tools like Airtable, Amplitude, Hubspot or Excel
You have SQL experience","It's a bonus if you have:
Familiarity with the gig economy is a plus.
You have an interest in Product Management as a career!
How will an internship with Moves benefit you?
Get real world experience, working with teams and gain leadership experience
Acquire knowledge about fintech, one of the fastest-growing industries in tech
Build your network
Get an idea of what you do and don't like doing
Lay the groundwork for a post-grad career
What do we offer?
Hourly pay range is CAD$25-27, depending on experience and work term
We will ship hardware to you
Remote friendly
Interview process:
Interviews will take place on September 28, 2021
30 minutes video call to discuss the opportunity and the organization with Ben Carroll, Senior Product Manager
Background check
Offer","Targeted Clusters

column1: Multimatic Technical Centre (MTC), a Division of Multimatic Inc. is hiring for a Senior Design Engineering Student.

World class Markham based automotive systems engineering organization requires a Senior Mechanical or Mechatronics Engineering student to join its design team.  MTC's product specialties include automotive chassis and suspension systems, electro-mechanical body hardware components, closures, and performance road and race vehicles.  State-of-the-art product development facility has a design office using industry leading CAD software, comprehensively equipped prototype shop for metal and composite fabrication, testing laboratory equipped to perform a variety of component and full vehicle tests, motorsports department for building, developing, and testing race cars, and an industry leading simulation group.","Work term experience will include sound exposure and practice of design methodology including packaging, layouts, clearance studies, calculations, tolerance stacks, detailing, capability analysis, kinematics studies and providing general assistance to the engineering staff.  Projects will be assigned in manageable segments and the student is encouraged to work independently to solve associated tasks and problems.

The successful candidate will work with the Engineering staff with all required training being provided.  This is an entry-level position into an exciting and progressive company.  Note that a large majority of the full-time Engineering staff are graduate co-op students.  This is an opportunity to join an exciting and progressive company and be exposed to all areas involved in product/vehicle development.","Applicant qualifications should include the following:
Mandatory:
High level of interest in automotive engineering
Strong personal motivation and desire to learn and be challenged
Good knowledge of engineering layout and drawing practices
Good aptitude for 3D visualization: application system training will be provided.
Desirable:
CAD experience with CATIA or NX (or comparable 3D Design software)
Working knowledge of MATHCAD
Exposure to Automotive Engineering disciplines such as: FMEA's, QFD, Design of Experiments, DVP&R's etc.","Targeted Clusters

column1: JOB TITLE:                 Senior Analysis Student
REPORTS TO:             Analysis Manager

DEPARTMENT:           Analysis","World class Markham based automotive systems engineering organization requires a senior Mechanical, Mechatronics or Systems Design Engineering student to join its structural analysis team.  MTC's product specialties include automotive chassis and suspension systems, electro-mechanical body hardware components, closures, and performance road and race vehicles.  State-of-the-art product development facility has a design office using industry leading CAD software, comprehensively equipped prototype shop for metal and composite fabrication, mechatronics group for developing software and hardware, testing laboratory equipped to perform a variety of component and full vehicle tests, motorsports department for building, developing, and testing race cars, and an industry leading simulation group.

A work term in the Analysis Department will include exposure to linear and nonlinear static and dynamic simulations ranging from component level evaluation (stiffness, strength, natural frequency) to complete vehicle performance assessment (i.e. crash simulation, chassis stiffness, vehicle dynamics, etc.).  Students will create and run finite element models (typically using HyperMesh and Abaqus/Standard), review results, and make/explore recommendations for design improvements.  The successful candidate will work with a Structures Engineer and all required training will be provided.","3rd or 4th year mechanical/mechatronics/systems design engineering student with automotive experience
High level of interest in automotive engineering
Knowledge of the finite element method and it application to the analysis of mechanical systems
Good aptitude for 3D visualization
Good written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational skills
Effective problem solving skills
Experience with commercial finite element pre-processors and solvers desirable
Experience using multi-body kinematics and dynamics packages (e.g. ADAMS, MotionView, etc.) useful but not required","Targeted Clusters

A work term in MES will include exposure to electro-mechanical systems in automotive applications.   Students will design, fabricate, and troubleshoot automated drive and control systems utilizing industrial and purpose-built controllers, software and mechanisms.","Basic Requirements:

column8: ,4 month work term,Coop students at the firm typically arrive at the firm and are paired up with an associate or senior engineer. The student will work with the associate/senior engineer and help the associate with day to day work. The student will be incorporated into a team and will take on tasks assigned by the associate or the project lead. The exact team that the student will be on is often unknown until closer to the start date, but our teams typically work on designs for large buildings. However, as an engineering consulting firm, our scope of services includes many other project types.

column1: Depending on the student's growth and development, there will be opportunities to work on more complex designs and projects and take a larger role in the associated work. Individuals who demonstrate an excellent ability to communicate, enjoy being challenged and who can learn quickly are encouraged to apply.","1) Visit job sites to review existing electrical installations, documenting existing electrical distribution

column1: Munich Re is one of the world's leading reinsurance companies with approximately 45,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe.  As an industry leader, we provide a unique opportunity to be part of a global success story.  We offer our employees a diverse and challenging work environment which champions high performance, professional development, innovation and passion; and rewards high performance.

Our co-op placements provide you with an excellent opportunity to practically apply your classroom and technical training in the reinsurance industry. While with our team, you'll be; coached by experienced industry professionals, exposed to Munich Re leadership, challenged as a valuable team member and contributor doing meaningful work, and mentored to develop a solid foundation that will help position you as a future leader in the field.
Position Overview

You'll work closely with other Actuarial Associates and Actuaries within their respective departments, as well as with other key individuals across the organization in Pricing and Reserving, in our Toronto office.
Note that this opportunity is with Munich Reinsurance Company of Canada, a property and casualty reinsurer subsidiary of Munich Re.","Job Responsibilities
Work term responsibilities will vary depending on the department you're placed; which may include, but not be limited to the following:
Pricing
Assist in improving reinsurance pricing tools;
Support with reinsurance benchmark rate study;
Participate in setting of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and other assumptions;
Assist in reinsurance treaty pricing;
Monitoring existing Managing General Agents (MGA) business and evaluating new MGA business opportunities;
Support with facultative, single risks, and MGA pricing as required;
Development of the monitoring report;
Provide additional support in other actuarial areas, as needed.","Qualifications

First and foremost, we're looking for well-rounded individuals who are technically astute, have strong communication skills, and demonstrate the ability to build positive relationships.  We're seeking collaborative professionals who are excited to join our winning team and show promise of becoming a future leader in the reinsurance space.
Specifically, we're looking for the following qualifications:
Currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science, Math, or Statistics, or equivalent program in healthy academic standing;
Excellent communication skills: spoken & written, formal/informal presentation;
Proven capability to multi-task and successfully self-manage multiple priorities and projects of various significance;
Effective working both independently and as part of a greater team;
Exhibits solid organizational skills and rigorous attention to detail/accuracy in a fast-paced environment;
Demonstrates leadership qualities: clear-thinking, curiosity, integrity, and drive;
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, as well as experience with spreadsheet and database applications;
Exposure to VBA is considered an asset;
Preference for candidates who have relevant work experience, having already completed at least one placement (or approx. 4+ months in-field experience).","Targeted Clusters

column1: LOCATION: Toronto, ON or Montreal, QC
DURATION: 4 Months

Munich Re's track record as one of the world's leading reinsurance companies is based on a solid capital foundation, in-depth risk expertise and market know-how.  Our data, our technology, and our teams place us in a unique position to lead the change to redefine the nature and impact of reinsurance for the future.  We're investing strategically in our world class talent, offering our employees a diverse and challenging work environment which promotes professional development, innovation, and passion; and rewards high performance.

Our co-op placements provide you with an excellent opportunity to practically apply your classroom and technical training in the reinsurance industry. While with our team, you'll be; coached by experienced industry professionals, exposed to Munich Re leadership, challenged as a valuable team member and contributor doing meaningful work, and mentored to develop a solid foundation that will help position you as a future leader in the field.
Position Overview

You'll work closely with other Actuarial Associates and Actuaries within their respective departments, as well as with other key individuals across the organization in our Toronto and/or Montreal office.

Note that work placements by department will be assigned closer to the term start date based on a number of factors, not limited to: your interest, skill set, and internal business needs.","Job Responsibilities
Work term responsibilities will vary depending on the department you're placed; which may include, but not be limited to the following:
Biometric Research:
Assist with developing mortality, morbidity, and lapse assumptions for Life and Living Benefits insurance products;
Conduct and review company and industry experience studies;
Develop actuarial insights from analyzing large Canadian and US datasets;
Support Pricing and Valuation on pricing quotes and assumption review/analysis;
Prepare presentations and other material to communicate results internally or externally.
Individual Reinsurance Solutions:
Evaluate and communicate profitability for pricing reports, reinsurance proposals;
Model and make recommendations for client requests and special quotes;
Assess profitability impact on new business portfolio from changes in assumptions and methodologies;
Help ensure treaties and amendments are drafted and signed in a timely manner;
Provide actuarial support to internal departments (claims, underwriting, admin, etc).
Bilingual Individual Reinsurance Solutions (Montreal):
Bilingual (French/English): spoken & written requirement in addition to the responsibilities above.
Corporate Actuarial:
Assist in quarter-end financial reporting including conducting reserve movements and analyzing profitability across all Canadian lines of business;
Prepare results across multiple different bases including Canadian GAAP, Solvency II, USGAAP and local capital requirements (LICAT);
Support in the review and analysis of actuarial assumptions, such as mortality, lapse and morbidity;
Contribute to special projects such as IFRS 17 and revamping AXIS models and processes;
Gain exposure to software, such as AXIS, SQL and Power BI.
North American Model Development (NA MD):
Contribute to the NAV (North American Valuation) project which includes review and consolidation of current valuation Axis models spanning all lines of business across Canada and US.
Propose and implement model enhancements, ensure model design is efficient, consistent and easy to update.
Quantify and explain impacts of model changes, new Axis functionality and new data under multiple reserving bases, as applicable (SII, USGAAP, US Stat, CGAAP)
Implement new business treaties in valuation models and explain any change in results relative to Pricing modelling.
Global Actuarial Consulting Group (GACG):
Assist in the development of implementation tools used by Munich Re offices around the world (e.g. IFRS17 Transition Calculators).
Build actuarial models for unique, region-specific reinsurance structures for internal global clients (includes both valuation and pricing models for new quotes).
Review regional actuarial models for governance and process improvements.
Support experience studies and development of actuarial assumptions for new quotes.
Provide stewardship services globally related to Munich Re's actuarial modelling and experience analysis software.","Qualifications

We're looking for well-rounded individuals who are technically astute, have strong communication skills, and demonstrate the ability to build positive relationships with internal clients.  We're seeking energetic and collaborative professionals who are excited to join our winning team and show promise of becoming a future leader in the reinsurance space.
Specifically, we're looking for the following qualifications:
Currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science, Math, or Statistics, Risk Management, or equivalent program, in healthy academic standing;
Successful completion of one SOA exam (with two or more preferred);
Excellent communication skills: spoken & written, formal/informal presentation;
Demonstrated ability to create and manage positive professional relationships with good client service acumen;
Proven capability to multi-task and successfully self-manage multiple priorities and projects of various significance;
Exhibits solid organizational skills and rigorous attention to detail/accuracy in a fast-paced environment;
Demonstrates leadership qualities: clear-thinking, curiosity, integrity, and drive;
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Access, and Word;
Exposure to AXIS is considered an asset;
Preference for candidates who have relevant work experience, having already completed at least one placement (or approx. 4+ months co-op/intern experience).","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,POSITION: LIFE Data Engineering Co-op

column1: LOCATION: New York, NY or Toronto, ON
NUMBER OF POSITIONS: 3

Munich Re is one of the world's leading reinsurance companies with approximately 45,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe.  We work with our client companies on the hardest problems in risk assessment.  As an industry leader, we provide a unique opportunity to be part of a global success story.  We offer our employees a diverse and challenging work environment which champions high performance, professional development, innovation and passion; and rewards top performers with a highly competitive total rewards package.

Our Co-op & Intern placements provide you with an excellent opportunity to practically apply your classroom and technical training in the financial services industry. While with our team, you'll be; coached by experienced industry professionals, exposed to Munich Re leadership, challenged as a valuable team member and contributor doing meaningful work, and mentored to develop a solid foundation that will help position you as a future leader in the field.
Position Overview

Munich Re sees the use of data as instrumental in making it easier for people to buy life insurance and to expand the number of people insured.  Integrated Analytics (IA) is a new team leading this effort in the US and Canada for the North American Life business.  With us, you'll work closely with data scientists and other data engineers to build solutions that apply AI and machine learning techniques to data.  As a start-up within a larger company we have the ability to build from scratch and employ modern computer science approaches.   You'll be immersed in real-time business problems while engaged in a collaborative approach to delivering world-class, innovative solutions.  Our interns and co-op students build solutions that are deployed in our production platforms.","Job Responsibilities
Responsibilities may include, but will not be limited to the following:
Contribute to various on-the-go projects, related to the following areas of concentration (as needed and as fits with your focus):
Building data pipelines based on modern IT architectures (batch & streaming): configure extract/transform/load software and rules engines;
Image recognition and natural language processing to capture data from unstructured data including image, text, and handwriting;
Adapting and customizing machine learning and natural language processing to execute core data ingestion and transformation tasks (translations, validations, exception detection);
Continuous integration / continuous deployment workflows and cloud deployment (DevOps);
Support with the development of Python based applications and predictive models deployed as RESTful microservices;
Expand the team's use of cloud computing software by prototyping new software as service (SaaS) or platform as service (PaaS) capabilities;
Participate in various research projects in the field of statistics, machine learning, and deep learning: collaborating with our greater team of scientists and engineers.","Qualifications

First and foremost, you'll demonstrate a natural desire to provide exceptional client service through your energy, enthusiasm, and initiative. Specifically, we're looking for the following qualifications:

Currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Information Technology, Engineering (Computer, Software, Physics, Bioinformatics) or equivalent program offering coursework working with large datasets;
Experience working with any of the following: Python, Flask, SQL, API or web development, Hadoop and Distributed Computing;
Familiarity developing software or analyzing large datasets;
Solid communication skills; spoken & written, formal/informal presentation
Note that this opportunity is open to current students who are returning to in-class studies upon the completion of the internship.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,At National Research Council (NRC), we developing smart textile technology for maintaining health and well-being of seniors and thus reducing their need for nursing home care. The technology will integrate actuators and sensors into textile wearable products to provide daily and on-demand physical stimulus to the aged wearers at home. It aims to create an innovative living environment for seniors and help them to safely live at home.

column1: One of our target for the technology development is to have a wearable product that can provide electrical stimulation to body without using external power supply but using the energy harvested from people's motion. We are hiring one co-op student to join the team to develop the yarn-based energy harvest devices that can be easily integrated into textile wearable product for the purpose. The technology development is focused on creating multi-layer functional coatings on each individual fiber within a conductive yarn (there are hundreds of fibers within each yarn), and using the coated yarn to braid functional yarns that can be integrated into textile by conventional method. The candidate is expected to work on the chemistry/formulation of the coating materials, coating process, and the characterization of the obtained yarns regarding their electrical performance and structure.

The to-be hired student will mostly work in chemical and processing labs, and characterization labs, and have the exposure to various processing and characterization equipment. The student will work independently under the supervision of project leader and will have the opportunity to collaborate with other students and research/technical staffs within the organization.","Key activities include some of the following:
Chemistry and formulation of the materials for coating fibers in conductive yarns.
Process for coating each individual fiber in a conductive yarns.
Performance and structure characterization of the coated yarns.
Writing report and publication.
Key Specifications include:
The work will be performed under supervision; however, the incumbent will be required to learn quickly and work independently.","Experience in a laboratory environment and working independently.

column8: ,4 month work term,Printable electronics has attracted a lot of interests in recent years from both academia and industry. The technology is based on using a combination of new functional materials and cost-effective, large area printing processes to enable new devices and systems that were not possible using traditional semiconductor processes. The key advantage of printable electronics is the ability to make large area, flexible, and lightweight electronic devices.

column1: Printed porous materials are able to adsorb and even transport chemical and biological molecules without external energy and the materials can be easily integrated with electrical components through printing. The integration makes it possible to fabricate biological and chemical sensors with the flexibility in manipulating surface chemistry and device structure. The technology is expected to have a great competition advantage in senor-fabrication cost, sensing variety and sensing performance.

The to-be hired student is to work in this area. He/she will integrate our invented printable porous materials and sensing technology to develop a new technology platform and associated method for sensing biologicals. The main focus is on the formulation, printing, and the integration of the materials with electrical components through printing. Application of the fabricating devices for sensing glucose will also be studied. The student to be hired is expected to have good experimental skills and is good at writing reports and research papers.","Key activities include some of the following:
Formulation, printing, and surface modification of the printable porous materials.
Integration of the porous materials with electrical components through printing.
Design, printing, and testing of integrated glucose sensors.
Writing report and publication.
Key Specifications include:
The work will be performed under supervision; however, the incumbent will be required to learn quickly and work independently.","Experience in a laboratory environment and working independently.

Ability and dedication to complete a job and to meet deadlines. Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision. Ability to learn and acquire new knowledge, skills and techniques. Desire to develop a successful professional career.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Working in the Advanced Electronics and Photonics Research Centre in Ottawa, ON, the incumbent will assist research officers by developing new organic semiconductors for applications in printed organic electronics.

column1: Organic semiconductors are the core of printed electronics, which have found a wide variety of technical applications. The performance and fabrication process of organic electronic devices largely depend on the inherent properties of organic semiconductors. Recent five years have seen rapid increase in the power conversion efficiency of organic photovoltaics due to the development of new high-performance materials. The student will assist Research Officers and Postdoctoral Fellows in performing scale-up synthesis of new n-type materials for solar cell applications, and will provide electronic-grade materials to the device team.

The incumbent will be trained in how to use Schlenk line to run moisture- and air-sensitive reactions, and how to purify products by distillation, column chromatography, and recrystallization.",Carry out multi-step organic synthesis and optimize the reaction conditions to improve the reaction yields.,"Solid knowledge of organic and polymer chemistry and hands-on skill in the purification of organic products by column chromatography, distillation and recrystallization.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Employer: National Research Council Canada (NRC)

column1: Title: Data Maintenance Coordinator - Co-op Student
Group & Level: Co-op Student
Branch: Industrial Research Assistance Program (IRAP)

The National Research Council (NRC) is the Government of Canada's largest research organization supporting industrial innovation, the advancement of knowledge and technology development. It represents a powerful partnering option for anyone looking to push the boundaries of science and industry.  We believe that when great minds come together and provide solutions to real problems, great things happen: passions are fueled, opportunities are uncovered, and success is all but guaranteed.

This position will be to support the National Research Council's Industrial Research Assistance Program (NRC-IRAP).  NRC-IRAP supports small and medium-sized enterprises (SME) in Canada to grow and create wealth through technological innovation. NRC-IRAP helps firms to develop technologies and successfully commercialize them in a global marketplace. NRC-IRAP provides technical and business advisory services and financial assistance to the small and medium-sized enterprises they serve.

Within the Toronto, Bay Street office the co-op student will assist IRAP on multiple projects, lend a hand to different teams doing a multitude of duties, track and report on different projects and deadlines.
Key Activities :
• Undertake research of policy and problem statements, conduct analysis, prepare and present detailed reports on issues related to transfer payments, innovation, science and technology policy.
• Assist in tracking and management of tasks, take meeting minutes, summarize and analyse information, prepare briefing notes, presentations and other materials.
• Support multiple teams with their deliverables, track and report of progress.

As a student joining NRC, you will undertake career-related projects in an engaging and intellectually-stimulating environment. We are looking for a Data Analyst student who will be mandated to maintain and cleanse data in SONAR and other regional applications and to provide assistance to client users on the use of these systems.","Your primary duties will include:

• Creating and maintaining master data such as client master records, project master records, activity master records and all other related information.  This entails examining the documentation and discussing the contents of the file with subject matter experts to determine the appropriate data entry requirements.  Consult with ITAs to determine the appropriate code.

• Providing information to regional users on the Sonar applications system modules related to the master data.  Create databases and develop custom reports on those and existing corporate databases using tools such as Microsoft Access and Microsoft Excel.
• Discussing and consulting with the client user groups to proactively identify data quality issues, interface with appropriate staff and develop tool sets to assist in solving issues.

• Identifying systematic and recurring problems related to data quality of Sonar and other applications system and assisting NRC-IRAP's IM/IT group in the problem resolution by providing support services such as documenting system deficiencies, identifying causes of problems (such as missing data:  NAICS codes, performance data on a firm &/or inconsistent information between Sigma and Sonar) and recommending solutions.

• Providing technical services relating to data quality issues from a regional perspective to ensure timely and effective resolution of master data applications related problems, including responding to urgent situations involving system failure and or working out difficulties in systems serviced.

• Assisting in the establishment and maintenance of a problem reporting systems, tracking output, analysing results and taking the necessary actions to ensure an effective level of services is maintained.

• Performing on-going cleansing of master data by reviewing and monitoring the use of data, removing duplicate or erroneous data and archiving master data no longer in use in accordance with established business rules and procedures.

• Monitoring trends and development in industry and government on systems technologies, enhancements and hardware features related to master data technologies and data base requirements and system upgrades and designs.","Key Specifications:
• Ability to research, analyze and summarize complex situations and communicate results in a clear and compelling manner in both writing and oral
• Effective interpersonal skills and working cooperatively with team members to achieve common goals.
• Demonstrate interest in public policy and entrepreneurship
• Knowledge of Microsoft Office including Word, Perfect, PowerPoint and Excel.
• Experience in Engineering Management is an asset.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Black Carbon Metrology Team conducts research and provides metrology services for traceable measurements to improve emissions inventory and control, develops diagnostic instrumentation and calibration protocols, and informs policy and regulators in the areas of civil aviation, marine, and road transportation, and the oil and gas sector. The Team is composed of dynamic research and technical officers with diverse professional experience and training including: mechanical and chemical engineering, physics, and chemistry. The team uses a multi-disciplinary approach to solve the latest problems related to short lived climate pollutants - black carbon and methane.

column1: Black Carbon Metrology is offering one position which could cover any one of the tasks described under Job Responsibilities.","Measurement of potent greenhouse gases such as methane is important for constraining current emission rates and to confirm efficiency of emission mitigation efforts. Unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)-based measurement of gas plumes is advantageous to capture the entire profile of a plume. Despite the widespread availability of UAVs today, lightweight instruments worthy of flight that can offer very high sensitivities (parts per billion) to probe naturally-diluted gas plumes is still a challenge. You will have access to Canada's state-of-the-art mid-infrared technology to apply your electronics, prototyping, and signal processing skills to improve the performance of a gas sensor employing a distributed feedback (DFB) diode laser and an ARM-based embedded system. Your will work on identifying and reducing sources of noise in added-on DAC and ADC components (and associated circuits) by performing frequency domain analysis. This project involves hands-on analog and digital circuit design and printed circuit board (PCB) prototyping, use of delicate laboratory instruments, embedded system programming in C/C++ in a LINUX environment, programming in LabView®, MATLAB®.","Analytical Ability

column11: Medical and Industrial Dosimetry Laboratory Assistant

column1: ,National Research Council Canada,Metrology Research Center,1,Open for Applications,Ottawa,Intermediate,0,

column8: ,4 month work term,Update fundamental cross section calculations in the EGSnrc software

column1: Within the Ionizing Radiation Standards Group at the National Research Council of Canada, a team is dedicated to the Monte Carlo simulation of radiation transport using the renowned open source software EGSnrc (github.com/nrc-cnrc/EGSnrc). This software was created and developed by this group over nearly 40 years and is used worldwide to model the passage of electrons and photons through materials, in particular in the field of medical physics for research in medical imaging and radiation therapy.

One key feature of EGSnrc is the ability to model material composition and density accurately. Regions of various materials in the simulation are each represented as homogenous volumes? (optionally with molecular form factors). For the purpose of a transport simulation, a material is wholly specified by its cross sections, which in turn depend on atomic composition, density, and mean ionization energy (the I-value). However the rate of energy loss of an ionizing electron in dense media is famously less than expected from single-atom scattering theory, due to the density effect arising from the dielectric polarization of the media. Hence simulations incorporate density effect corrections, in the form of data tables which have been generated manually with the ESTAR software from NIST (physics.nist.gov/PhysRefData/Star/Text/ESTAR.html). This process is cumbersome and error-prone, undermining confidence in reference dosimetry simulations.

There are two main objectives in this project: 1) integrate a density effect correction code into EGSnrc, so that it is calculated on-the-fly from material parameters, instead of relying on data tables generated by users; and 2) validate the existing density effect correction calculation and material data files distributed with EGSnrc, especially in view of the latest recommendations by the International Commission on Radiation Units (ICRU Report 90). This project will involve implementing the density effect correction calculations into C++ (using the venerable Fortran ESTAR code as a baseline), while getting trained in fundamental aspects of ionizing radiation travelling in materials and Monte Carlo simulation methods.
Specifically, the following project steps are envisaged
Understand the physics of density effect corrections, and its implementation in ESTAR
Implement a C++ version of density effect correction calculations
Integrate the new C++ ESTAR code inside the EGSnrc initialization routines
Review existing EGSnrc density effect correction files and material data

This work involves a strong computational flavour, with a software development environment geared for the GNU/Linux operating system. At the end of the work term the student will be confident in running advanced EGSnrc radiation transport simulations involving practically any material. EGSnrc development is done publicly on github, hence the student can easily showcase code contributions to prospective employers. The student will be under the functional supervision of Dr Reid Townson within the Medical and Industrial Dosimetry team, but will work as part of the IRS team responsible for Monte Carlo simulations and the development of the EGSnrc software.","The project would be suited to either a physics undergrad with a leaning towards coding or a computer science student with an interest in physics!
Medical Physics",Physics and Medical Physics,"Targeted Clusters

column1: The National Research Council of Canada's (NRC) Metrology Research Centre prepares high-quality and reliable certified reference materials (CRMs) for industrial and academic research.
