This work will include both hardware and software development, and careful measurement work.

column8: ,4 month work term,If you are a dynamic, motivated and determined person,  Energy Technology Sector (ETS) at Natural Resources Canada is for you! The Alternative Energy Laboratory (AEL) at CanmetENERGY-Ottawa is looking for a student to work in research and development as part of the Ultra Efficient Heating Equipment program.

column1: Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values. We believe that diverse teams bring different perspectives and creative ideas that benefit our clients, the communities we serve and all of us as colleagues. We welcome application from individuals with diverse abilities and from all backgrounds and identities.

ETS has a diverse and highly skilled workforce with 585 employees across the country.  It is NRCan's third largest sector representing more than 15 percent of the department's workforce, with 50 percent of the staff located in three CanmetENERGY labs in Devon (AB), Ottawa (ON), and Varennes (QC), and one CanmetMATERIALS lab in Hamilton (ON).

In addition to being large and regionally dispersed, IETS exciting mandate offers a wide range of career choices including :  Engineering (EN-ENG), Engineering and Scientific Support (EG), Scientific Research (SE-RES) occupational groups and others. Among the Executive Cadre at IETS, women hold 60% of the executive positions.

The Alternative Energy Lab at CanmetENERGY is a team of engineers and building scientists researching technologies suitable for energy-efficient houses and commercial buildings.  The team performs experimental and real world testing and uses computational tools to evaluate the performance of technologies for use in Canada.  Mechanical systems the team has assessed in the past include: gas-fired combined space and hot water heating systems, variable capacity air source heat pumps, solar assisted air to water heat pumps, advanced distribution of heating and cooling using zoning and integrated controls for hybrid furnace / air source heat pump systems.

Our sector, ETS, is also committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage candidates to indicate voluntarily on their application if they are a woman, an Indigenous person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.

Here at CanmetENERGY-Ottawa we promote work-life balance and a happier, healthier workforce.  We offer a variety of physical activities for all ages and abilities.  Our facilities offer four seasons of various activities from indoor yoga and HITT training, to outdoor activities such as hockey (ball and ice), volleyball, soccer, running groups and more.  In addition, because we are located in the west end of Ottawa in the NCC Greenbelt, we have access to trails nearby for walking or cross-country skiing.
CanmetENERGY-Ottawa has been named one of Canada's Healthy Workplace Month® Great Employers for the second year in a row (2019 & 2020)!
http://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2020/12/15/2145196/0/en/Excellence-Canada-and-Canada-Life-announce-the-2020-Canada-s-Healthy-Workplace-Month-Great-Employers.html","Position Description

The candidate will assist with the Ultra Energy Efficient (UEE) Space and Water Heating System project, activities undertaken to support NRCan's Office of Energy Efficiency as well as the NRCan Innovation Fund ""Empowering Youth in First Nations Communities with Solar for Hot Water"" Project.  Tasks will include assisting with:
UEE Project:
Setting up sensors to monitor system performance
Working with National Instruments and Campbel Scientific software to log data and initiate performance tests
Collecting, synthesizing, analysing and visualizing data
Development of performance maps of technologies for simulation purposes
Writing performance assessment reports based on measured results
OEE Equipment:
Supporting the development and publication of Guides and reports including editing reports, undertaking complex Excel data analysis and graphic visualization work
Supporting field monitoring projects including data capture, synthesizing and analysis
Innovation Fund Project:
Supporting the development of Design Guides, Installation Manuals and other materials
Assessing the performance of a prototype solar thermal hot water system

Evaluating the cost effectiveness and cultural appropriateness of various technology solutions for the community","The successful candidate will be enrolled in a Building Science degree, Engineering (Mechanical, Energy preferred), Engineering Technology, Architecture or Environmental Sciences program and will have:
a good standing academic record
effective communication skills with team members and willingness to speak up when unsure of tasks
independently motivated
good technical writing skills
knowledge of mechanical systems for heating, cooling and/or ventilating homes and buildings
experience with performance assessment (synthesizing large data sets and using charts and visual methods to clarify findings)
assets would include:
knowledge of experimental methods and experience with building science instrumentation
experience with setting up tests in a laboratory setting (i.e., experience with installing sensors, calibration, programming data logging equipment, data collection)
experience with installation / commissioning of mechanical systems in homes (e.g., furnaces, heat pumps, heat recovery ventilators, water heaters)
The candidate will gain experience in experimental setup, monitoring and performance assessment, data analytics & visualization and report writing.
Your new ideas and fresh perspective can make a difference in the clean energy that we develop. Learn more about CANMET and some of the research projects that you could contribute to.

Position Description
Buildings and Renewables / Hybrid Energy Systems
Internet of Things and Artificial Intelligence
Ultra Efficient Heating Systems, Advanced Energy Cycles and Transportation Project

R&D activities in the Hybrid Systems and Advanced Energy Cycles Laboratory of CanmetENERGY's Buildings and Renewables (BRG) group are focused on developing new technologies that will have a direct impact on reducing the energy consumption and minimising greenhouse gas emissions.  Examples of previous and ongoing projects at BRG are: Modelling, simulation and experimentation of micro-co/trigeneration and solar thermal energy systems, design of low-grade energy (solar, renewable) residential and community utilisation systems, evaluation of the impact of electric vehicles on the electricity grid and on GHG emissions energy systems' performance optimisation and AI control strategies developments. These research activities are aimed at reducing the pollutant impact of stationary and mobile energy systems and significantly increase their efficiency.","One (1) position for 'Research Assistant' will be available for the winter 2022 work term.
The student in this position will be involved in some of the following projects:
1) Internet of Things (IoT) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) applied to improve performance of energy systems in buildings;
2) Simulation study on heat pumps (HPs), hybrid HP-organic Rankine cycle micro-combined cooling, heat and power system performance, data post-processing and analysis of results;
3) Techno-economic studies of hybrid energy systems based trigeneration systems using alternative green fuels.

Additionally, the student will also assist in activities like designing new sub-systems involving IoT, AI, and data logging and processing.","This position offers an excellent opportunity for first-hand experience with the next generation energy systems and for gaining a broad understanding of the Canadian energy picture. We are looking for a strong candidate who understands thermal energy processes, power systems and their operation, database programming, and proficient in using Matlab, Simulink, Python, Visual Basic, SolidWorks or equivalent and/or Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) tools. The candidate should be capable of working in a research and development environment and able to organise his/her work with minimum supervision.
Your new ideas and fresh perspective can make a difference in the clean energy that we develop. Learn more about CANMET and some of the research projects that you could contribute to.

The Renewable Heat and Power Group at CanmetENERGY-Ottawa is seeking to hire a co-op student for the winter 2022 term to advance R&D initiatives related to offshore wind energy. The ideal candidate will be proficient in working with geospatial data and Geographic Information Systems (GIS), be adept at problem solving, capable of reviewing and distilling scientific literature, and be broadly interested in renewable and low-carbon energy systems.
Primary duties of the position:
Conducting geospatial-based analysis to determine suitable areas for offshore wind development in Canada, building off previous analysis completed within the Wind Group.
Compiling, organizing and combining geospatial data layers to inform various types of analysis.
Examining available offshore wind energy technologies and integrating their system characteristics into the suitability analysis.
Developing various maps and web applications.
Preparation of reports and presentations to disseminate information on results of the geospatial analyses to various audiences.
Collaborating with members of the Federal Geospatial Platform (FGP) and other geospatial scientists across the department.
Requirements of the position:
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program in Geography, Geomatics, Earth Sciences, Geographic Information Systems or equivalent.
Experience with creating, organizing, manipulating, analyzing and presenting geospatial data.
Proficiency using one or more GIS software packages (i.e. ArcGIS, QGIS, etc.) to perform various operations on geospatial data layers, including multi-constraint analysis.

Ability to apply software programming concepts and techniques to geospatial datasets to generate customized outputs including dynamic web applications considered an asset.","Your new ideas and fresh perspective can make a difference in the clean energy that we develop. http://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2020/12/15/2145196/0/en/Excellence-Canada-and-Canada-Life-announce-the-2020-Canada-s-Healthy-Workplace-Month-Great-Employers.html","Position Description

The BioEnergy Group of CanmetENERGY Ottawa conducts research & development into renewable energy systems based on biomass and biomass-derived fuels.  A new project is starting on the carbon capture options for the lime kiln in a kraft pulp mill producing negative carbon emissions.  An experienced, independently motivated chemical engineering student with coding skills is required to further the BioEnergy Group's new project. The student is may be required to contribute to other projects within the BioEnergy Group.  The student is needed to:
Develop or update codes for a reactor model of the lime kiln firing biofuels with air or oxygen and carbon dioxide recycling;
Process model for carbon capture technologies at scale and processing necessary for pipeline injection;
Process modeling of the lime kiln and other parts of the causticizing loop in a kraft pulp mill; and
Prepare reports, documentation and user guides on all of the above and contribute to scientific articles.
Good interpersonal skills and ability to work independently are essential.  Experience coding in Python or Matlab is required.  Experience using MS Access is an asset.
The program requirement is: Bachelor of Chemical Engineering.
Work: 37.5 hours per week.

Language Requirement: English","Your new ideas and fresh perspective can make a difference in the clean energy that we develop. Learn more about CANMET and some of the research projects that you could contribute to.

http://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2020/12/15/2145196/0/en/Excellence-Canada-and-Canada-Life-announce-the-2020-Canada-s-Healthy-Workplace-Month-Great-Employers.html","Position Description

The Government of Canada aims to make Canada a net-zero carbon country by 2050. While over 80% of Canada's electricity is already produced from non-emitting sources, carbon-emitting fuels like natural gas, gasoline, and diesel are still the standard in many industrial processes, for heating homes and buildings in many provinces, and in transportation. A large transformation of the energy system is required to replace these fossil fuels by cleaner alternatives (for instance electricity, hydrogen, and biofuels), or to capture, transport and store the CO2 from facilities that produce or consume these conventional fuels.

R&D activities in CanmetENERGY's Hybrid Energy Systems Group are focused on supporting Canada's transition towards a net-zero carbon energy system through the development and evaluation of new technologies in the buildings and transportation sectors.

A position for a 'research assistant' will be available for the winter 2022 work term. The student in this position will work on a project aimed at identifying and mapping future sources of CO2 from distributed hydrogen production facilities that feed hydrogen refuelling stations along Canada's highways. Additionally, the student may also be involved in projects related to electric vehicle charging infrastructure planning and optimization.","We are looking for a student with above average computer skills, who enjoys the challenge of 'going deep' into one or several subjects. The student will work with GIS (Geographical Information System) software, and may also assist in activities like: literature study, data logging and mining, advanced energy system modelling, simulation and optimization. This position offers an excellent opportunity for first hand experience with transformational research to combat climate change and for gaining a broad understanding of the Canadian energy picture.
Your new ideas and fresh perspective can make a difference in the clean energy that we develop. Learn more about CANMET and some of the research projects that you could contribute to.

CanmetENRGY-Ottawa is developing direct carbon fuel cell (DCFC) technology for clean energy generation. This technology will help with better utilization of carbon derived from methane thermal cracking as well as from the agricultural/forestry residues (biomass). The DCFC generates clean electricity and produces CO2 that will be recycled in the cell or sequestrated. The theoretical efficiency of converting carbon into electricity is 100 %. To achieve high efficiency of the cell in a practical cell set-up, it is crucial to develop stable, compartments for the cell that can survive high temperatures and highly corrosive conditions. Development of all aspects of this technology are
The candidate selected for this position should have some knowledge on fuel cell technology; basic knowledge using chemical laboratory tools for preparing solutions, using scales, mixers etc.
Students duties include the following:
Plan and conduct daily experiments.
Acquire materials for the experimental work.
Prepare solutions for editing electrodes.
Prepare eutectic slats and operate high temperature cell.
Organize and report experimental results.
Illustrate data with graphs and charts.
Write research reports.
Conduct literature survey and report the relevant findings.

The student will be supervised by the lead research scientist for this project, and will work closely with engineers and technologists.","Your new ideas and fresh perspective can make a difference in the clean energy that we develop. column1: NAVBLUE is the flight operations services and software solutions arm of Airbus. Our products cover both the on-ground pre-departure  preparation phase of flight, like flight plan determination and runway aircraft performance analysis, through  to post-departure support, like situational display aircraft tracking and on-board mission execution.

We have a wide breadth of initiatives that cover both new product green field development as well as established product architecture changes and enhancements. There is a strong push for product harmonization on a new long-term common platform that uses cloud-native development, AWS, our own UI toolkit based on Vue.js and QT, and event-based architecture. All of that is happening in concert with existing product enhancements to mission-critical applications and services.

column8: ,4 month work term,Technical Writer

column1: NCR's Waterloo Software Engineering organization is building world-class banking applications used by some of the top financial organizations in the world.  We are currently hiring a co-op student for a Technical Writer position in Waterloo, for a 4, 8, 12, or 16-month work term. If you're looking for a chance to get hands-on technical writing experience, helping to produce high-quality documentation that contributes to the overall success of our products used by some of the top banking organizations in the world, consider joining the NCR team.  NCR was recently named a ""Top 100 Global Tech Leader"" by Thomson Reuters.  Our Software Engineering organization uses contemporary writing tools to deliver innovative solutions to the customers we serve.

In collaboration with team members, the technical writer is required to gather, organize, read, and analyze new and existing product information to document new or changing product functionality. The technical writer will also identify necessary revisions to existing documents, write technical topics to bridge gaps in information, and implement those changes. Where necessary, the person in this role will identify and create appropriate graphics to complement technical topics that meet or exceed standards and are appropriate for their intended audiences. The technical writer must be comfortable interacting with colleagues in software development, program and project management, and other technical roles in an Agile development environment.","Key Duties and Responsibilities may include:
Collaborating with internal team members to obtain a comprehensive knowledge of the product and documentation requirements
Reading, analyzing, and clarifying Information Engineering source documents
Writing topics for product features or release bulletins
Analyzing existing and potential content to identify areas for improvement or where additional information is needed
Participating in daily stand-up meetings
Editing product documents
Contributing to a policy and procedures handbook","The NCR Technical Writer Co-op student will have the following qualifications:
Excellent school performance in a Humanities or Social Science program Students from a Technical Writing, Rhetoric, or English program preferred
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Comprehensive understanding of English grammar and syntax
Knowledge of accepted standards for technical communication
Great analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated initiative and leadership
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Diverse interests, a passion for technology, and an enthusiasm to learn new things
Ability to create and achieve objectives
Key knowledge & skills required:
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint)
Familiarity with content management systems and major web browsers (Chrome, IE)

Additionally, experience with the following technologies and skills is considered an asset, but they are not prerequisites.  These are some of the technologies you may get hands-on experience learning and using during your work term:
Adobe Acrobat, FrameMaker, Author-it, or MadCap Flare
Jira and Confluence
Agile/Scrum environment
Experience writing in adherence to a style guide","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Software Engineer in Test

column1: NCR's Waterloo Software Engineering organization is building world-class banking applications used by some of the top financial organizations in the world.  If you're looking for a chance to get hands-on software experience, helping to solve challenging issues and applying your passion for automated test development to ensure high-quality software, consider joining our NCR team.  NCR was recently named a ""Top 100 Global Tech Leader"" by Thomson Reuters.  We are using state of the art technologies along with Agile software development methodologies to deliver innovative solutions to the customers we serve.

As a Software Engineer in Test, you will be part of a larger Agile scrum team and will be helping to ensure that software features are working as intended by designing, coding and executing automated tests (typically in JavaScript) using frameworks such as Cucumber or TestCafe, as well as defining and executing manual tests. You will collaborate with Product Owners and other Developers on your team to contribute to planning and design, clarify requirements, formulate test scenarios, write code to automate test scenarios using various frameworks, set up test data as required, execute automated and manual tests and record test results.","Key Duties and Responsibilities may include:
Authoring acceptance criteria for Agile stories
Identifying required test cases and scenarios to validate software based on requirements
Designing and coding software for automated testing of applications
Executing manual tests and analyzing results for adhoc scenarios and bug fixes
Participating in design reviews, code reviews, and test scenario/test case reviews
Deploying and configuring various systems, tools and applications for development and testing purposes
Troubleshooting deployment problems
Documenting defects associated with testing
Validating fixes for defects

Collaborate with ""the team"" - working with Product Owners, Software Developers, Scrum Masters and Project Managers to deliver solutions and capabilities that exceed expectations","All NCR Software Engineering personnel have the following characteristics:
Excellent school performance
Great analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work independently on diverse problems
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Attention to detail
Diverse interests and a passion for technology
Enthusiasm to learn new things
Demonstrated initiative and leadership
The ability to make and meet objectives
Specific technical knowledge and skills required:
Java
JavaScript
APIs and JSON/REST web services

Additionally, experience with any of the following technologies and skills would be an asset but are not prerequisites.  These are just some of the many technologies you may get experience learning and using during your work term:
Cloud-native technologies such as Docker Containers and Kubernetes
Cloud providers such as GCP and AWS
Package managers such as Helm
Active MQ/IBM MQ/JMS Messaging
React, AngularJS or other JavaScript frameworks
HTML 5 and CSS
NoSQL Databases (e.g. Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Redis)
Spring Boot framework
Git or Bitbucket
YML files
Maven
Jenkins
Linux
VM ware
Postman for API execution/testing
Automated unit testing (e.g. JUnit, Jest)
Test frameworks (e.g. Cucumber, TestCafe)
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Neo Financial,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Calgary,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",4,"

column8: ,4 month work term,At Neo, we empower people to get the most out of their money and time. We're a tech company reimagining everyday banking from the ground up to create rewarding experiences and build community for all Canadians. We're looking for passionate go-getters who want to move fast and create a lasting impact.

column1: This is a full-time 4 month term starting in Jan 2022, with the possibility of an extension to 8 months. Plus our internships can often lead to a permanent position within Neo Financial! Join our team today to gain real hands-on experience that shapes the next generation of business.

This internship is open to post-secondary students, currently enrolled in your 1st, 2nd, 3rd or 4th year, and are returning to full-time or part-time studies in Spring 2022. Candidates must be located in Calgary, or open to relocate for on-site work.","What you'll be doing:
Working on a candid and friendly team with bright and ambitious software engineers, product owners, and designers.
Learning how a hyperscale startup works and contributing to our business goals
Uncovering existing and future problems with our web, Android, and iOS apps, and the backend software that powers our bank.
Carefully communicating the problems you uncover so they can be prioritized
Finding out why those problems happened in the first place and as you grow in the role, fixing some of the problems","Who we're looking for:
An entrepreneurial work ethic
An eye for detail and the heart for quality
An attitude of going out of your way to help and teach those around you
Obsessed with delighting our customers and stakeholders
Programming skills (we'll assess interns with a Leetcode Easy problem)
Testing skills (we'll assess interns with an objective testing problem)
An aptitude for puzzle solving and/or engineering work
Effective communication skills
What will help you succeed:
Familiarity with the Linux command line / bash
Ability to gain your co-workers' trust
Comfortable asking questions to senior team members","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,NerdWallet Inc,Head Office,1,Open for Applications,Remote in Canada,Intermediate, Senior",36,"

column8: ,4 month work term,NerdWallet is seeking a Data Science Intern who is passionate about working in a high-growth start-up environment where there are real opportunities to make a meaningful and positive impact on consumers'  financial lives. A Data Science Intern will work on machine learning problems with a complete workflow, from data gathering and discovery, to modeling and evaluation, and production deployment. Problems we tackle will impact our educational and transparency products which are discovered and used by millions of consumers.

column1: As an intern at NerdWallet, you will thrive in an environment where we value creativity, teamwork, and a ""consumer-first"" product culture. Our small teams of ""Nerds"" provide you with the unique opportunity to collaborate with and learn from experienced data scientists and engineers, as well as business and product area owners, thus evolving our products into a delightful, efficient, and seamless experience. By the end of your internship, you will be well on your way towards becoming a well-rounded Data Scientist and product innovator who embodies the unique NerdWallet culture.
This internship takes place between January thru April.","Where you can make an impact:
- Deliver on high visibility data science projects that improve on the relevance of NerdWallet's financial advice to our customers
- Collaborate cross-functionally with other data teams at NerdWallet to define best practices and leverage shared platforms, insights, and innovations
- Own data and ML pipelines that empower product teams and increase the impact of data science throughout the organization","You are:
- Creative problem solver: Passionate about answering questions with data
- Structured thinker: Understand how to break down complex problems into the key components where data science and machine learning can be used to improve existing solutions
- Enthusiastic Collaborator: You are able to participate in building cross-disciplinary support and developing solutions in order to improve our products
- Consumer first and positive attitude: Motivated to work hard in a fast-paced environment ? business decisions here can connect and impact millions of users
Your experience:
- We recognize not everyone will have all of these requirements. If you meet most of the criteria below and you're excited about the opportunity and willing to learn, we'd love to hear from you.
- Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or advanced degree in a math or sciences field. (For example: engineering, statistics, economics, biology, physics, social science, etc)
- Strong computer science fundamentals and hands on experience with Python
- Foundational knowledge in probability and statistics
- Passion and interest in big data, machine learning, new programming languages, and technology stacks","Targeted Clusters

Our small teams of ""Nerds"" provide you with the unique opportunity to collaborate and learn from seasoned engineers (along with being paired to a technical mentor), thus enabling you to have a significant impact in building our internal tools and systems.","Where you can make an impact:
- Contribute to improving the monitoring and alerting infrastructure critical to performance and reliability
- Participate in improving the reliability of the NerdWallet website

- All about repeatable automation: if you've solved the problem, you should never have to visit it again.
- You care just as much about how well our software runs as how well it's written.

column1: ,NerdWallet Inc,Head Office,3,Open for Applications,Remote in Canada,Intermediate, Senior",103,"

column8: ,4 month work term,At NerdWallet, we are passionate about helping consumers make the right financial decision by building delightful product experiences. We are looking for talented Software Engineering Interns who are passionate about working in a dynamic, high-growth start-up environment. As an intern, you have a real opportunity to make a meaningful and positive impact on how consumers interact with their finances. You will be fully embedded into one of our teams and work on a variety of technical challenges (front-end, back-end, full-stack, mobile) to help design, build and maintain high-performance scalable systems that will support NerdWallet's rapid growth. Our Engineering culture offers continuous learning.  It is an environment where we value creativity, teamwork and a ""consumer-first"" product culture.

column1: During your time here, you will be embedded onto a team and paired with a technical mentor and manager who are there to help you succeed. Our team of ""Nerds"" provides you with the unique experience to collaborate and learn from seasoned engineers in our organization enabling you to have a significant impact in building our products. All Engineering Interns work in cross-functional multidisciplinary teams that include Product Owners and Designers to allow you to understand the direct impact of the products we build. By the end of your internship, you will be well on your way towards becoming a well-rounded Software Engineer and Product Innovator who embodies the unique NerdWallet culture.","Where you can make an impact:
-Design and build web and mobile products that are performant, secure, scalable and sustainable.
-Build and extend search, machine-learning and content infrastructure that enables NerdWallet users to search for and find relevant and personalized content.
-Drive improvements to our back end, data and front end infrastructure that will scale as NerdWallet's products and audience grow.
-Develop and extend a crowd-sourced Q&A platform that helps consumers by connecting them with subject-matter experts in personal finance.

-Build interesting tools for data quality, data integration, performance, QA and Operations (on top of AWS) that will make a positive impact on our software development process and site-operations.","You have:
- Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field.

- Strong computer science fundamentals and hands-on experience with a passion for writing industrial-strength code and building high-performance, scalable systems in Python, Javascript, HTML/CSS, Scala, Java or PHP.
- Familiarity with technologies like React, Redux, Node.js, Express.js, ElasticSearch, Flask, MySQL/Postgres, Kafka, Redis, AWS/Redshift.
Bonus:
- Passion and interest in learning new programming languages and emerging technology stacks.
- Passion about open-source software is a plus.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,NERv Technology Inc,Divisional Office,2,Open for Applications,Kitchener,Intermediate, Senior",8,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,NERv aims to create a paradigm shift in post-operative care, utilizing the plethora of data within the body, to help in the detection of post-operative complications at their onset. NERv's platform sensing technology augments existing wound drains and catheters, providing healthcare providers with a smart monitoring tool that can enhance the delivery of care. NERv's technology is being built with the goal of decreasing surgeon's response time to potential complications, making patient recovery easier, and hopefully saving lives.

column1: As a Data Scientist Augur at NERv, you will be working in a fast-paced and cross-functional technical team. You will primarily be working with data from our clinical and animal trials and using it to help develop our AI/ML pipeline for cutting-edge early anastomotic leak detection models.
This position will require you to come into our Kitchener, ON offices for at least 50% of the time.","Process, clean and verify incoming data from clinical/animal data
Explore and implement ML pipeline (data exploration, sampling, training data generation, feature engineering, model building, and performance evaluation)
Identify, interpret, and communicate meaningful insights from clinical/animal trial data
Identify any improvements for the data collection and analysis processes
Prepare documentation of models, designs and techniques used
Communicate findings and insights to other teams

Assist R&D team in sensors manufacturing","You're self-driven and able to adapt in a fast-paced environment without losing attention to detail. You thrive in facing open-ended challenges in uncharted territory, and you're ready to dive into the deep end with minimal guidance. You're not afraid to take the driver's seat, love to learn and can quickly grasp new concepts as they arise during your work. If this sounds like you, we'd love to meet you!
Required Skills:
Proficient in Python for data processing, statistical analysis, machine learning and visualization and skilled in writing SQL queries
Ability to: compile, correlate, and compute results from large sensor time series datasets and draw tangible conclusions and develop machine learning models
Experience in descriptive and predictive modelling
Experience with implementation of data visualization
Excellent critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
A curious and proactive attitude
Knowledge of biosensors is preferred but not required","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,NERv Technology Inc,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Kitchener,Intermediate, Senior",13,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,Who We Are

column1: NERv aims to create a paradigm shift in post-operative care, utilizing the plethora of data within the body, to help in the detection of post-operative complications at their onset. NERv's platform sensing technology augments existing wound drains and catheters, providing healthcare providers with a smart monitoring tool that can enhance the delivery of care. NERv's technology is being built with the goal of decreasing surgeon's response time to potential complications, making patient recovery easier, and hopefully saving lives.

As a Production Associate, you will take a leading role in the continuous development, implementation, and improvement of NERv's production processes from the beginning to end. This includes processes such as device assembly, device quality control, material procurement, inventory management, and product delivery. You will also take a central role in ensuring that NERv's needs for devices for its ongoing clinical trials are fulfilled. This involves activities such as the planning, supervision and execution of production runs.

For this role you should expect to work closely with the design and development team for the purpose of improving design manufacturability and scalability. You will also work closely with the quality team to make sure our production processes are designed and executed in compliance with regulatory standards. This position will require you to come into our offices located in Kitchener, ON. NERv's move from design to production is at its early stages which provides a great opportunity for an eager hire to create significant impact and leave a real footprint.","Responsibilities
- Contribute to the development and improvement of NERv's production and manufacturing processes while ensuring compliance to ISO standards for medical device manufacturing, in particular, ISO 13485.
- Serve as a central resource for planning, supervision, and execution of production runs.
- Analyse and optimize NERv's assembly line design, facility layout, and process workflow for the purpose of maximizing production efficiency and yield rates.
- Contribute to the manufacturing activities of NERv's devices, assembly machines and fixtures, and device packages as per design specification and regulatory requirements.
- Execute cost analysis activities on the device BOM and drive changes to bring costs down.
- Design, develop and execute material procurement and inventory management processes.
- Design, develop and conduct time studies and work simplification programs.
- Conduct equipment and facility maintenance activities according to quality management standards.
- Contribute to the design, development and validation of NERv's device packaging.","Skills/Qualifications
- A bachelor's degree in Industrial, Manufacturing, Mechanical or Mechatronics Engineering, related engineering degree or in-progress is required.
- Excellent project management skills.
- Multidisciplinary experience in process or equipment engineering.
- Familiarity with mechanical design using industry-standard tools (e.g. AutoCAD, Solidworks).
- Familiarity with CAPA, lean/six-sigma, or other continuous improvement techniques is an excellent asset.
- Familiarity with design for manufacturing, assembly and scalability principles is an excellent asset.
- Knowledge of manufacturing and prototyping process (e.g. SLA, SLS, injection-molding, laser cutting) is an asset.
- Ability to work in a high-pressure environment and constantly changing conditions.
- Excellent written and verbal technical communication skills.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,The candidate would join the R&D Engineering team to support the research, development and manufacturing of our proprietary sensor modules and upstream sensor technologies. The candidate will primarily work with the team to design, execute and improve existing sensor-related processes and research projects. They would also provide assistance to our clinical, manufacturing and data analysis teams as needed.","Design, improve and test sensor-related processes.

column1: Plan and execute experimental procedures for various research projects
System preparation and technical support for Product as well as Clinical/Animal Studies
Assist in data ingestion and analysis for incoming data from Product and Clinical/Animal Studies
Analysis, thorough documentation, and presentation of R&D data
Troubleshooting and root-cause analysis of sensor behavior on field, often with limited datasets
Propose sensor technologies to future product requirements, assess feasibility, and plan for integration into product pipeline

Assist our internal R&D and manufacturing teams wherever needed","You're self-driven and able to adapt in a fast-paced team environment without losing attention to detail. You thrive in a collaborative, cross-functional team setting and want to work with like-minded, high performers ? even when the pressure builds up. You will often be facing real-world and open-ended challenges, and you're ready to dive into uncharted territories. You can question the status quo and fall back to the fundamentals of the natural world. You're not afraid to take the driver's seat, love to learn and can quickly grasp new concepts as they arise during your work. If this sounds like you, we'd love to meet you!
Qualifications
Experience with biosensor-related research (Design of Experiments, report generation and presentation, etc.)
Systematic methodology for scientific experimentation with clear alignment to project goals
Ability to switch between ""hack-y prototyping"" and ""scientifically rigorous"" mindsets depending on project stage and requirements
Comfortable working in a research lab setting (handling hazardous and biohazardous materials)

column8: ,4 month work term,Newfront (YC W18) is the modern insurance brokerage that uses technology to transform the client experience and improve the lives of brokers.

column1: Insurance is a half a trillion dollar market that plays a foundational role in our economy and society but is generally slow, archaic, and filled with paperwork. Newfront is building the modern insurance brokerage. We leverage technology to simplify the selling process for brokers and the buying process for clients. Our singular mission is to create the future of work for this massive industry.
>> To learn more about the technology we're building, watch our video Engineering at Newfront
>> To learn more about our mission and values, check out our Careers Page or Key Values
>> To learn more about our funding, check out this Forbes article

Our CTO Gordon was a YC founder and his last company StackLead was bought by LinkedIn and our CEO Spike was on the early team at Opendoor. We already have 200+ brokers on the platform (our first hire was the head of commercial insurance at Zenefits) and raised a Series C from top VCs. We were recently featured on Breakout List as well as Angellist's fastest growing startups in San Francisco. We're a unicorn at $1.35B valuation.","As a software engineer, you'll work with our brokers to automate repetitive tasks and clients to improve their experience buying insurance. We'll work together to pick a project that you can own end-to-end and broadly you'll:
>> Prioritize features by rapidly testing mockups and MVPs
>> Build a delightful customer user experience using Next.js/React
>> Work closely with our brokers and customers to get feedback
Some example projects include:
>> Build a claims management portal for Account Managers to track claims and share this info with customers
>> Build a Chrome extension to automatically pass data to insurance carrier websites

>> Write a machine learning model to parse insurance policies and identify common features between different carriers","We're looking for backend, frontend, or full-stack engineers with experience coding in an industry-standard language (e.g. Java, Python, C++, Objective-C, JavaScript).
We prefer candidates with TypeScript experience. Our product backend is a Node.js/Express server and the frontend uses the Next.js framework with React.

More importantly, you should have a passion for shipping product and hearing feedback from real users. If you're hungry to grow as an engineer, we're happy to support you learning new technologies.","Targeted Clusters

column1: There are no limits on how fast you'll advance your future career with us. We are always looking for driven, smart people with a keen interest in enterprise software.

column1: ,Nicoya Lifesciences Inc,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Kitchener,Intermediate, Senior",21,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,About Us:

column1: Nicoya's mission is to improve human life by helping scientists succeed. We are a fast-paced, rapidly growing company based in Kitchener, Ontario - Canada's Silicon Valley, but have a world-wide presence. We have a team of world class engineers, scientists, and designers building disruptive products to help researchers make their next big discovery. Our first product, OpenSPR, is a scientific instrument for the biotechnology research and development industry. It provides detailed information on molecular interactions using optical nanosensor technology known as localized surface plasmon resonance. It is the most affordable SPR instrument on the market and has disrupted an industry that has been primarily dominated by highly expensive and complex instrumentation.
About the Job:

We are looking for a passionate and talented engineering or science student to join our team and help us build amazing products. At Nicoya, we love to work hard and play hard, and we are always working to continuously improve our products. Our team is expanding and we need more talented people to join our mission!
Who you are:

You love a challenge and you're a life-long learner. You thrive off of solving technical challenges in the development of new products to meet short and long-term customer goals. You want to provide some of the world's top researchers with the best technology to help make research simple for them and help them get the data they need to make a difference in the world. You have excellent technical proficiency with a balanced understanding that user experience is everything. You love stepping out of your comfort zone while also keeping track of your day-to-day tasks. You want to be a part of a thriving small team and you have great communication and teamwork skills. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging problems. You have a proven track record for setting and meeting aggressive goals.","Duties:
Work as part of the product development team on systems integration and application development projects
Design, perform and analyze SPR assays to demonstrate product capabilities
Develop and execute test plans to verify various aspects of the product to ensure functional requirements are met
Analyze and present test results to the team, and provide recommendations on next steps
Identify, report and investigate failure modes, and participate in cross-functional root cause investigation and mitigation efforts","Our Ideal Candidate Is:
Enrolled in a BS degree in Nanotechnology Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Biochemistry, or other related engineering/scientific discipline
Able to work in-person at Nicoya's headquarters in Kitchener, ON.
Experience working in a wet-lab environment and with common lab equipment (e.g. pipettes, scale, pH-meter, etc...)
Familiar with Excel and Python for data analysis
A fast learner with a high level of critical thinking and attention to detail
Able to adapt quickly to changing priorities
Bonus Qualifications:
Experience working with spectrometry
Experience working with nanoparticles, surface science and/or microfluidic devices
Experience with Surface Plasmon Resonance (SPR) and/or similar analytical techniques","Targeted Clusters

column1: Nicoya's mission is to improve human life by helping scientists succeed. Our newest product, Alto, is a scientific instrument for the biotechnology research and drug discovery industry. It is the first SPR instrument on the market to incorporate Digital Microfluidics technology which has disrupted an industry that has been primarily dominated by highly expensive and complex instrumentation. We recently raised $10 million in Series A funding to boost development, sales and marketing initiatives for Alto.","Your project:

Help execute test plans for assay validation
Ensure traceability from requirements and specifications to verification.
Participate and provide critical input in group discussions
Gather and analyze data from user interaction studies
What you will gain from this co-op experience:
Learn about the pathway to regulatory approval for a cutting edge medical diagnostic product.
Learn about bio-design from a user perspective.
Hone your presentation and public speaking skills.
Make plenty of career connections!","Preferred qualifications:

column1: Northbridge

The Power of Together - Join Northbridge, a growing dynamic company that has a long and rich Canadian history in providing innovative insurance solutions to customers nationwide. Northbridge Financial Corporation is a leading commercial property and casualty insurance company that's been helping protect Canadian businesses for more than 90 years. We're 100% Canadian! We offer a wide range of creative solutions to our customers through our Northbridge Insurance, TruShield Insurance and Federated Insurance brands where we strive to create a fair and friendly culture, upheld by the foundation of our five corporate values: respect, passion, connectedness, creativity, and excellence.

By continually striving to challenge the status quo, and by focusing on helping the customers we have the privilege of insuring achieve the possibilities of their business, we've been able to build our reputation as one of Canada's largest commercial insurance providers. To help us continue to build on this success, we're committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people. Be part of a team that's passionate about making a difference every day, fuelled by our entrepreneurial spirit and where everyone owns a part of our success. Our company has had an amazing journey so far, and our future is full of new possibilities!

Located in the heart of Toronto's Financial District, our head office is easily accessible by TTC and GO Transit, and within walking distance to the Eaton Centre, Scotiabank Arena, Rogers Centre, and CN Tower. As a national property and casualty commercial insurance provider, we also have offices across Canada.
Fairfax Co-op Program

Northbridge is apart of the Fairfax Co-op Program. The Fairfax Co-op Program is looking for innovative, talented and self-motivated University of Waterloo students who are interested in domestic and international work experience throughout the Fairfax group of companies. Visit co-op.fairfax.ca to learn more!","The co-op placement will have the opportunity to:

column1: About Northbridge
The Power of Together - Join Northbridge, a growing dynamic company that has a long and rich Canadian history in providing innovative insurance solutions to customers nationwide.

Northbridge Financial Corporation is a leading commercial property and casualty insurance company that's been helping protect Canadian businesses for more than 90 years. We're 100% Canadian! We offer a wide range of creative solutions to our customers through our Northbridge Insurance, TruShield Insurance and Federated Insurance brands where we strive to create a fair and friendly culture, upheld by the foundation of our five corporate values: respect, passion, connectedness, creativity, and excellence.

By continually challenging the status quo and by focusing on helping our customers, achieve the possibilities of their businesses, we've been able to build our reputation as one of Canada's largest commercial insurance providers. To help us continue to build on this success, we're committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people. Be part of a team that's passionate about making a difference every day, fuelled by our entrepreneurial spirit and where everyone owns a part of our success. Our company has had an amazing journey so far, and our future is full of new possibilities!

Plan and facilitate meetings as needed;
Project related duties are at the discretion of the assigned Project Manager and may include status reporting, log management and general analysis.","Skill/ Behaviour Requirements:

column1: ,NorthWest Healthcare Properties REIT,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate",4,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About NorthWest:

column1: NorthWest Healthcare Properties REIT has a unique origin story.  Since its founding in the early 2000's, health care real estate was for small local investors in Canada. We identified an opportunity to become a visionary institutional partner in our Canadian marketplace.  After establishing our Canadian roots, we have over the past decade, expanded to international soil.

We connect people to places and with a focus on the ""cure"" side of real estate. NorthWest has a diversified portfolio of 189 properties and $8 billion assets under management located throughout major markets in Canada, Brazil, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand. NorthWest is continuing to expand its global healthcare portfolio to provide long-term healthcare solutions, including exploring new markets and partnerships.  We leverage over 250 professionals across nine offices in five countries to serve as a long-term real estate partner to leading healthcare operators.
Our team:

At NorthWest, we realize we are ""better together"".  Our employees are part of an entrepreneurial culture where you can grow and develop.  Our teams are collaborative, and we support the development of our employees through unique job assignments, development and coaching.

We offer a hybrid work environment including the opportunity to work in-office at our downtown Toronto office location (subject to COVID restrictions) to allow you to engage with the broader team and maximize the learning you will receive on the job.

NorthWest is a pre-approved training office for CPA Ontario students. NorthWest in the process of registering this role with CPA Ontario to obtain practical experience as part of obtaining their CPA designations.
The Role:
Reporting to the Tax Manager, you will become a key member of the REIT's tax function.  Specifically, you will:
Become key member of a growing international team of high performing CPAs and CFAs with diverse industry backgrounds, including Big 4 experience;

Be exposed to increasingly complex transactions, including international M&A and the various analysis, reporting, and structuring work required to facilitate transactions.  All of this is in the context of an aggressive growth strategy;
Have direct exposure and interaction to the REIT's executives and key senior management team members across the global finance team; and
Develop time management skills through coordinating and working virtually with the global finance team in various time zones and jurisdictions.","Key Responsibilities:
Assist in preparing the quarterly and annual consolidated income tax provisions for the REIT;
Assist in the preparation and review of Canadian trust and partnership tax filings, including Foreign Accrual Property Income calculations;

Assist in monitoring the REIT's Specified Investment Flow-Through compliance and maintaining the REIT's qualification testing including the preparation of complex Excel models summarizing the property and revenue of the REIT;
Attend meetings with global finance team members regarding quarterly reporting requests, ongoing transaction updates, and other key deliverables; and
Assist with ad hoc matters in supporting the REIT's transactions including but not limited to drafting structuring step decks, flow of funds models, and tax research.","Key Qualifications:
Possess a strong interest in accounting and tax fundamentals and an aptitude for learning on the job;
Pursuing a CPA designation or equivalent;
Ability to multi-task, remain organized, and work in an exciting, fast-paced, and team-oriented environment;
Ability to problem solve and think analytically;
Self-motivated, team-player, and ability to work independently;
Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
Proficient with the use of Microsoft Excel; and
Relevant tax experience will be an asset.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,NOVA Chemicals Corporation,Divisional Office,2,Open for Applications,Sarnia,Intermediate, Senior",8,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Who We Are:

column1: NOVA Chemicals develops and manufactures plastic resins and other petrochemical products that make everyday life safer, healthier and easier. Our employees take pride in our focus on safety and social responsibility by working together to ensure health, safety, security and environmental stewardship through our commitment to sustainability, ESG, and Responsible Care®. NOVA Chemicals, headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, is wholly-owned by Mubadala Investment Company of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates.

NOVA Chemicals helps shape a world where products vital to our health and happiness are even better tomorrow than they are today. We are seeking talented and passionate people who enjoy working in a collaborative, innovative environment to join our dynamic team.","WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

The position will be placed in one of the following roles depending on experience, interest and available vacancies.  Experience in these areas will provide the opportunity to gain exposure to both technical breadth and plant operations that will greatly help with selecting an area of specialization for your future career.
Process Design Engineering:

The design engineer is accountable for process design for new facilities or modifications and ensures compliance with applicable NOVA and regulatory standards. Responsibilities include conducting feasibility studies, equipment sizing and specification, development of heat and material balances, safety and hazard reviews, process specification, problem solving and optimization.
Operations/Contact Engineering:

The contact engineer is assigned to an operations area and works closely with the Operations and Reliability teams on a daily basis to provide technical and troubleshooting support. Responsibilities include providing technical recommendations to improve and optimize plant operation, maintain compliance with Responsible Care Standards and lead and/or assist in incident investigations.
Process Safety Engineering:

As a member of the regional process safety team the Process Safety Engineer will take the lead on qualitative and quantitative risk analysis for a variety of risk studies and project risk assessments. This person also participates in the annual facility Hazard Assessment program (PHA) and various Process Safety Management policies, metrics, and management systems to enhance site performance.
Environmental Engineering:

The environmental engineer supports the manufacturing sites with collection, analysis and trending associated with Environmental Programs. This position requires an understanding of monitoring program fundamentals, including field sampling methods, laboratory analytical techniques, and electronic data management along with statistical analysis tools to assimilate large quantities of data into clear and concise reports.
Process Control Engineering:

The Process Control Engineer monitors plant control system performance and develops automation strategies for plant optimization. This includes designing and tuning control loops, building steady state process models for optimization, evaluating new opportunities for advanced control, developing new multivariable control applications, and enhancing existing applications.","MUST HAVES:
Chemical Engineering discipline and formally registered in an internship or co-op program.
No previous experience required although it will be seen as an asset.
HOW YOU CAN STAND OUT:
You are passionate about your work and put care and thought into all that you do.
You are responsible and follow through with your commitments to others and to safety.
You are innovative and are willing to challenge your biases when problem solving.
You are collaborative, inclusive, and work well with others towards team goals.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,What is NPX?

column1: NPX was founded on the premise that innovation is the most important key to sustaining the nuclear energy industry. We source, implement and integrate innovative technologies to make things better at nuclear power plants. We bring the start-up mindset to innovate in all areas of nuclear project management and engineering.

We think differently and work differently. We are customer obsessed rather than competitor focused, passionate for innovation, long-term thinking and committed to operational excellence.  We are a family, driven by the excitement of building technologies, inventing products, and providing services that change lives and give back to our community.

We have a unique opportunity for a powerplatform developer to provide support to various nuclear industry projects.. In this role, you will provide support fir identifying, creating and configuring solutions to end-users; helping to define best practices and recommendations; and advise on architecture and roadmap for the technology. Ideally you poseess some experience with business intelligence or data analysis and will work heavily with the Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps and Power Automate), while working with an innovative and collaborative team.
Is NPX right for you?
Do you have an intellectual curiosity that causes you to explore, experiment and build?
Do you like working with cutting edge technology to find solutions or opportunities that push up the innovation curve?
Do you enjoy working in an open concept, start-up environment where collaboration, diversity and knowledge sharing are key values?","Responsibilities

Function as Sharepoint/PowerPlatform Solutions Intern responsible for supporitng work related to translating requirements into overall functional design including all components, integration specifications and reporting.
Support the design and development of SharePoint, PowerApps, PowerAutomate(Flow) Solutions based on client requirements.
Monitor  new sharePoint, PowerApps, PowerAutomate features and functionality and ensure changes are properly communicated and tested
Create sites, lists, views, forms, SharePoint Designer Workflows, and web parts

Support work with clients and project team to confirm detailed architecture for complex solutions, including external design (navigation, screens, reports) and internal design (software and hardware platform, connectivity, modules, back-end and front-end components, interfaces) based on established architectural standards
Works as part of a multidisciplinary team, including product owners, product managers, UX designers, and IT
Prepare technical documentation
Performs maintenance and enhancements and ongoing SharePoint and Power Platform administration

Works in partnership with project teams to provide input on new service delivery offerings","In this role you will obtain invaluable, hands-on technical experience that you can't learn in a classroom. column1: ,Nuclear Promise X,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Kincardine,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",18,"

column8: ,4 month work term,What is NPX?

column1: NPX was founded on the premise that innovation is the most important key to sustaining the nuclear energy industry. We source, implement and integrate innovative technologies to make things better at nuclear power plants. We bring the start-up mindset to innovate in all areas of nuclear project management and engineering.

We think differently and work differently. We are customer obsessed rather than competitor focused, passionate for innovation, long-term thinking and committed to operational excellence.  We are a family, driven by the excitement of building technologies, inventing products, and providing services that change lives and give back to our community.

We have a unique opportunity for an engineering student to provide support to various nuclear industry projects. The location of work will be both NPX's Kincardine office and the Bruce Nuclear Generating Station in Tiverton. Typical tasks include: fupport of emergent issues, engineering calculations and analysis, maintenance support, procurement support, and execution of minor design changes and support for Major Component Replacement (MCR) projects.
Is NPX right for you?
Do you have an intellectual curiosity that causes you to explore, experiment and build?
Do you like working with cutting edge technology to find solutions or opportunities that push up the innovation curve?
Do you enjoy working in an open concept, start-up environment where collaboration, diversity and knowledge sharing are key values?","What is a Nuclear Innovation Internship anyway?

In this role you will obtain invaluable, hands-on technical experience that you can't learn in a classroom. Our team will help you to roll up your sleeves and apply textbook theory and lab experience in creating solutions for real nuclear industry challenges. Your number one responsibility is to be a driver for innovation and bring a passion for problem-solving. You'll be thinking outside the box and ready to make an impact. You will also have the opportunity to:What you'll do:
Develop and lead internal innovation projects
Research new technology and potential applications in the Nuclear Industry;
Prepare capital justifications for new technology;
Lead technical advancement projects, resource and build internal support teams;
Continually incorporate lessons learned into new procedure and future designs;
Work with nuclear engineers and other stakeholders to create designs which maximize the value generated by operating automated equipment.
Manage the day-to-day activities of projects, communicate with stakeholder teams as necessary to ensure project deliverables meet quality expectations
Support the preparation of a pipeline of bankable project ideas and leverage innovative technologies and solutions for development
Review design documentation, technical specifications, applicable codes & standards, development and test plans.
Liaise with customer design, operations, and maintenance personnel to gather site-specific design information.
Participate in walk-downs of various equipment in the plant.
Prepare and present technical data to internal and external customers.
Ensure designs comply with applicable company, technical, and regulatory standards.
Support the development and estimating of engineering proposals.","You would describe yourself as....
·       Actively pursuing a degree in Engineering or a  related field
·      Having a passion for innovation and for cutting edge technology
·       Enthusiastic and experienced in working in a team environment
·       Having engineering and project management experience
·       Being a big Picture Thinker
·       Not afraid to step up and show us your creative side
·       Are eligible to work in Canada","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Role Overview

column1: We have an exciting opportunity for a Product Manager Intern to join our Product Development team. As Product Manager you will support project planning and execution of app and software development projects throughout the Product Lifecycle, including gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision, and working closely with engineering and support teams to ensure customer satisfaction.
Is NPX right for you?
Do you have an intellectual curiosity that causes you to explore, experiment and build?
Do you like working with cutting edge technology to find solutions or opportunities that push up the innovation curve?
Do you enjoy working in an open-concept start-up environment where collaboration, diversity, and knowledge sharing are key values?
Are you seriously passionate about giving back and supporting your community?
About us

NPX was founded on the premise that innovation is the most important key to sustaining the nuclear energy industry. We source, implement and integrate innovative technologies to make things better at nuclear power plants. We think differently and work differently. We are customer-obsessed rather than competitor focused, passionate for innovation, long-term thinking and committed to operational excellence. ?We are a family, driven by the excitement of building technologies, inventing products, and providing services that change lives and give back to our community.
At NPX we are committed to building a warm, inclusive, and diverse environment. We believe that people do their best work when they feel safe, empowered, and supported.","Your Responsibilities

In this role you will obtain invaluable, hands-on technical experience that you can't learn in a classroom. Our team will help you to roll up your sleeves and apply textbook theory and lab experience to creating solutions for real nuclear industry challenges. Your number one responsibility is to be a driver for innovation and bring a passion for problem-solving. You'll be thinking outside the box and ready to make an impact.
You will also have the opportunity to:
1. Develop and lead internal innovation projects
2. Work with customers to understand needs, and map requirements for future state of business processes.
3. Work with UX designers, developers, to refine customer needs and establish a plan for product development and delivery.
4. Attend the daily stand-ups and facilitate the agile process.
5. Partner with internal and customer IT personnel to deliver quality software on time.
6. Provide insight to stakeholders on the product and market
7. Manage all aspects of in-life products, including customer feedback, requirements, and issues
8. Host or participate in hackathons and workshops aimed at process simplification, automation, and technology implementation.
9. Lead initiatives to support charitable causes.
10. Perform all other duties as assigned.","What you bring to the table?
1. You are enrolled in Computer Sciences, Engineering or related field
2. Experience in a software development environment
3. Knowledge of the Agile Scrum framework and product management tools such as DevOps is an asset
4. Creativity/Innovation: Develop new and unique ways to improve operations of the organization and to create new opportunities.
5. Ability to understand business processes and communicate them effectively to others","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Nuvalence,Divisional Office,3,Open for Applications,Remote in Canada,Intermediate, Senior",59,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Everyone wants a career with impact. At Nuvalence, you'll be helping some of the world's most renowned and ambitious companies build winning cloud platforms. You'll also be joining a company co-founded by a Waterloo Alum!

column1: Nuvalence software engineers are problem solvers. While most have deep expertise in specific areas of the technology stack (front end, back end, data, security etc.), all are comfortable swimming across lanes. This is really important in delivering the product and platform outcomes that our customers expect.

Our engineers are most interested in solving business problems with cutting edge cloud technologies and distributed systems. Let's face it, most of this stuff is pretty new so ""10 years of experience"" isn't really a credible calling card. We're looking for fearless engineers who love ramping up quickly by getting their hands dirty with sophisticated, cutting edge technology. We want all of our staff to spend as much time directly working with clients as possible so being able to explain and justify technical decisions is also really important. We like the type of engineer that you can pair with a product manager and have them do their thing.
Across all of our roles, we look for folks who match the following general profile:
- Passionate about delivering commercial software products and platforms to market
- Deeply technical and constantly in a state of learning
- Able to communicate clearly and efficiently with a variety of audiences including developers, clients, customers, partners and executives
- Fearless in getting ""hands-on"" with technology and execution
- Strong understanding of modern software engineering processes
- Deep understanding and interest in cloud and distributed systems architectures
- Comfortable with ambiguity with a drive for clarity","- Work on a team with a get-things-done attitude, so you'll have lots of autonomy to create impact while tackling complex technical challenges
- Contribute to design and architecture investigations and decisions
- Identify, prioritize and execute tasks in the software development life cycle","- Experience with Java Spring, Node or React is preferred
- You have at least 8+ months of backend or frontend software development work experience
- You are a self and quick learner, regardless of the languages and technologies used
- Team player
- Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude
- Bonus if you have experience with unit testing / TDD
- Bonus if you have experience with the standard cloud providers (AWS / GCP)","Targeted Clusters
