column8: ,4 month work term,Please note that ODAIA is committed to provide a safe working arrangement to our students given the ongoing COVID-19 situation. We offer remote working arrangements for the 2022 Winter Term depending on the pandemic situation and public health recommendations at that time.

column1: About ODAIA
ODAIA noun
o·da·ia | \ 'oh-day-yeah \Ancient Greek word that means ""that for which a merchant travels"".

ODAIA helps sales and marketing teams by using AI to understand and predict customer behavior. Our signature SaaS product Maptual (focused on the medical and life sciences space), incorporates data and AI predictions so that our clients understand their customers on a deeper level and with the right people, faster. Some of our clients include Janssen, AstraZeneca, Ipsen, and Sandoz.

Founded in 2018 out of the University of Toronto, in collaboration with the University of Lausanne in Switzerland, ODAIA is led by experienced entrepreneurs, scientists, and AI industry veterans. Though we're working on serious, cutting-edge technology, we consider ourselves a collection of diverse, smart, collaborative, and passionate colleagues with a great sense of humor.
Our Mission
To help companies create sales and marketing efficiencies and grow revenues by transforming their businesses around the customer while driving engagement and commercial growth.

We're also on a mission to build an innovative, diverse, and ego-free business, where trust, innovation, and ownership are valued. You're on a mission too? We're here for it. We put an emphasis on career development for our employees, and the opportunities are extensive.
What's on Offer
- Remote working capabilities and hardware delivery
- Flexible hours. We believe in work-life balance.
- Working to productize state of the art Process Mining and ML algorithms
- Family-oriented startup culture with online social gatherings
- Tremendous growth, high impact role, and opportunities to learn and be challenged
Your day to day
- You will be part of a small team, with a large amount of ownership and autonomy for managing things directly.
- You will own a large part of the process from problem understanding, R&D, to shipping the solution.
- You will ship high quality, scalable and robust solutions with a sense of urgency.","You may be responsible for some of these tasks:
- Develop and productize new or existing ML algorithms under the supervision of our in-house data science experts
- Back-end development and deployment of new algorithms in popular cloud platforms such as AWS
- Microservice design and containerization of ML algorithms
- Parallelization of algorithms using various approaches: multi-thread, multi-process, and GPU parallelization
- Validation and testing of algorithms
- Front end development powered by React","- Understanding of data structures, algorithms and design principles and patterns. Let's make use of those courses!
- Knowledge of one or more common technology stacks: Python, Node.js, React, Java, .NET Core, etc...
- Experience in full-stack development with microservices architecture expertise is highly valued
- Familiarity with data manipulation, analysis and ML libraries","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Office of the Auditor General of Ontario,Office of the Legislative Assembly,15,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",4,"
,Office of the Legislative Assembly of Ontario,Central,3,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",12,"

column8: ,2 work term commitment required,Keeping Ontario's Legislative Assembly running smoothly takes many talented people, doing many different jobs-from camera operators and committee clerks, to purchasing officers and researchers. The Office of the Assembly is dedicated to serving Ontario's Parliament.

column1: Together, we provide non-partisan administrative and procedural services to all Members of Provincial Parliament, as well as operational support for the daily activities of the Legislative Assembly of Ontario. Our success is determined by the strength and diversity of our staff and by supporting our core values: integrity, inclusiveness, collaboration and excellence.

We have three co-op opportunities available. Each student will work one term in either procedural services, house publications or research, and a second term with a political party in a non-partisan role.  Each student must commit to these two work terms in 2022:
January 10, 2022 - April 22, 2022 - reporting into one of the branches of the Legislative Assembly

September 6, 2022 - December 16, 2022 - reporting into one of the Caucuses or Members' offices","Students will learn about the various offices and functions of the Legislative Assembly that provide support services to Members of Provincial Parliament (MPPs), gain knowledge of the legislative process, and be close to the important events of the day. The students will be exposed to various offices and functions of the Legislative Assembly that provide support services for the MPPs. They will be responsible for a wide variety of duties, dependent upon where they are placed.
Students will start the first work term in one of these three branches.
Procedural Services Branch

Assisting with organizing and facilitating committee meetings including scheduling meetings and witnesses, preparing/distributing materials, welcoming witnesses, assisting MPPs and committee staff, and cataloguing submissions/exhibits;
Potential opportunity to travel with a committee (circumstances permitting);
Updating Intranet sites, reviewing and revising manuals and other documents, scanning documents into archives, and entering data into a database;
Researching, drafting and proofreading papers on a variety of topics related to the history and/or functions of the Legislative Assembly.
House Publications and Language Services Branch
Taking notes of legislative committee meetings via Zoom;
Assisting in index and reference projects;
Potential to assist in compiling Orders and Notices and Votes and Proceedings documents;
Potential opportunity to travel as a committee reporter (circumstances permitting).
Legislative Research Service

Assisting public policy analysts in providing research and support to MPPs and legislative committees by for example performing literature reviews, summarizing government and stakeholder reports, and conducting cross-jurisdictional website research;
Helping to draft briefing notes on topical policy issues;
Using Excel and other applications to produce charts and graphics for research projects and publications;
Identifying and updating resources for online research publications.
Caucus offices or with Members' Support Staff
The second work term will be spent working with a Caucus office or a Members' office where students will be required to perform a variety of tasks. Duties may include:
Assisting in the preparation of briefing notes, writing profiles, conducting research and media scans for Caucus/Members' staff;

Managing calendars and scheduling, working on events (press conferences, receptions), attending scrums to take meeting notes, drafting communications, posting to social media and responding to constituents.
Duties applicable to all roles:
Occasional reception duties, filing, and photocopying as necessary;
Will have opportunities to attend Committee and House sittings, virtually and/or in person;
Other duties as assigned.","Qualifications:

Students are required to commit to two full work terms.  The ability to interact with all internal and external contacts in a professional, empathetic, objective, and non-partisan manner is required.  Candidates must demonstrate analytical abilities, research skills, an interest in current affairs and public policy, demonstrated communication skills (both oral and written), capacity to exercise tact and diplomacy, knowledge of Microsoft Office tools, familiarity with social media, scanning skills, and an appreciation for the Legislative process.

The Legislative Assembly of Ontario embraces diversity and as an equal opportunity employer is committed to creating an inclusive workplace while establishing a diversified qualified workforce. If you require accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please email your contact information to hr@ola.org for follow-up

Full-time opportunities may be available for students after graduation, depending on the hiring needs of the Assembly. For additional information about the Legislative Assembly of Ontario, visit www.ola.org","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Title: Economics Co-op student

column1: Number of Positions: 1
Supervisors' Title: Director
Salary: To be determined -- commensurate with skills and experience
Office Location: Downtown, Toronto (Note: moving and living expenses are not provided. All office staff are currently working from home due to COVID-19.)
Term: Four months beginning January 2022 with a possibility of a four-month extension
Position Summary:

The incumbent will support the staff's research on economic and fiscal issues, production of reports, assess the Ontario budget and economic outlook and update and maintain the FAO's databases and forecasting models.","Principal Responsibilities:
Provide support to FAO staff research and report-writing activities including:
Collecting and analyzing data; and
Creating custom tabulations, charts and other visuals to display the analysis.
Improve and utilize tools to extract, transform and import data from various sources to the FAO's Eviews and Excel databases.
Improve the design of the databases and their integration into forecasting models.
Other duties as required.","Understanding of economic concepts is required, and of government finances is an asset.

The incumbent must be currently attending university in an economics/finance or related program, with courses in statistics, information technology (programming) or other relevant fields. At minimum, candidates must be going into their third year of studies. Candidates with education or experience in economics/finance and programming are preferred.
Strong understanding of Excel is required, experience with R Studio and EViews is preferred.
General programming knowledge (e.g. loops, if-statements, functions) is required. Understanding of R, EViews programming language, VBA, Python and SQL is an asset.
Must be able to independently problem solve, have sound judgement and interpersonal skills, can work in a flexible team environment and desire to learn new skills.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions,Supervisory Division,2,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",10,"

column8: ,4 month work term,ABOUT OSFI

column1: The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) is an independent agency of the Government of Canada, established in 1987 to contribute to the safety and soundness of the Canadian financial system. OSFI supervises and regulates federally registered banks and insurers, trust and loan companies, as well as private pension plans subject to federal oversight.
JOB DESCRIPTION

The Actuarial Division (AD) at the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions is seeking two (2) motivated, energetic students to work remotely. This is a great opportunity that will provide actuarial experience in both property & casualty insurance and in life insurance with a focus on property & casualty insurance.

The student will gain experience in reserving and capital management, will be exposed to leading edge insurance issues and may support broader benchmarking projects from an actuarial perspective. The work will expose the student to actuarial practices for many Canadian insurance companies and provide valuable knowledge of the Canadian insurance market and insurance products being sold. This kind of knowledge can rarely be gained by working at any one insurer.

The student may have an opportunity to participate in on-site and attend external meetings. The student will gain insights into the workings of a financial regulator and how the insurance industry is regulated to ensure financial solvency.

Students will be working with and learning from very experienced actuarial professionals, this group has hired students for many years and is very experienced in supporting and facilitating learning by students.
A DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE WORKPLACE

OSFI is committed to having a skilled and diverse workforce representative of the Canadian population. Therefore, consideration may be given to qualified candidates who self-identify as members of one of the following Employment Equity (EE) Groups: Aboriginal peoples, Persons with disabilities, Members of visible minorities and Women. As such, we strongly encourage students who identify within the EE Groups and meet the job requirements of the position being staffed to apply and self-identify in their application.","DUTIES
- Conduct preliminary reviews and analysis of property & casualty and life insurance actuarial reports, including the Appointed Actuary's Report, and the Financial Condition Testing report.
- Provide support to assist in divisional projects and initiatives. e.g., OSFI qualitative impact studies, industry loss studies.
- Other duties as required","EXPERIENCE / SKILLS
- The ability to work on Excel spreadsheets.
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Excellent organizational skills.
- Basic knowledge of insurance industry.
- Basic understanding of financial analysis and financial systems.
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
- Ability to take initiative and find ways to conduct a task more efficiently.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,ABOUT OSFI

column1: The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) is an independent agency of the Government of Canada, established in 1987 to contribute to the safety and soundness of the Canadian financial system. OSFI supervises and regulates federally registered banks and insurers, trust and loan companies, as well as private pension plans subject to federal oversight.
More information about OSFI can be obtained by looking at the website www.osfi-bsif.gc.ca.
JOB DESCRIPTION

OSFI's Life Insurance Group (LIG) of the Insurance Supervision Sector (ISS) is seeking four (4) students with an interest in life insurance and/or the financial services industry to work remotely. These positions will provide the opportunity to gain financial, operational and analytical risk management experience, as well as provide insights into the Canadian insurance sector, the workings of a financial regulator and exposure to senior leaders within the insurance sector. This is a great learning experience for any business, finance, accounting, risk management or economic student looking at building knowledge of the regulatory environment as a lead into a career at OSFI or in the financial industry.
To show that you have reviewed the job description in detail, please include the name of OSFI's current Superintendent in your cover letter.
A DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE WORKPLACE

OSFI is committed to having a skilled and diverse workforce representative of the Canadian population. Therefore, consideration may be given to qualified candidates who self-identify as members of one of the following Employment Equity (EE) Groups: Aboriginal peoples, Persons with disabilities, Members of visible minorities and Women. As such, we strongly encourage students who identify within the EE Groups and meet the job requirements of the position being staffed to apply and self-identify in their application.","DUTIES
Providing support to the supervisory teams in assessing the safety and soundness of insurance companies, which will include
Monitoring, analysis and reporting of financial and non-financial risk in application of OSFI's Supervisory Framework
Developing agendas, drafting of meeting notes and preparing other supporting material
Risk management through monitoring and on-site reviews of financial institutions
Data review and analysis of financial institutions and industry information
Financial risk analysis and reporting on the insurance industry and markets
Providing support with planned and adhoc divisional projects and initiatives
Other duties as required","EXPERIENCE/SKILLS
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Highly motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to take initiative and find improved ways to conduct a task more efficiently
General understanding of the insurance industry
Strong analytical skills with the ability to work on Excel spreadsheets and other MS software
Experience dealing with highly sensitive or confidential information
Experience with risk assessment / risk management would be an asset","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,ABOUT OSFI

column1: The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) is an independent agency of the Government of Canada, established in 1987 to contribute to the safety and soundness of the Canadian financial system. OSFI supervises and regulates federally registered banks and insurers, trust and loan companies, as well as private pension plans subject to federal oversight.
More information about OSFI can be obtained by looking at the website www.osfi-bsif.gc.ca.
JOB DESCRIPTION

OSFI's Model Risk Division (MRD) is seeking one (1) student with an interest in banking to work remotely. This position will provide the opportunity to gain risk measurement, risk analytics and/or broader analytical experience, as well as provide insight into the workings of a financial regulator. You will be working with a team responsible for assessing the methodology, governance and oversight of models used by Federally Regulated Financial Institutions (FRFI). These include regulatory capital models and those used for other enterprise functions or activities. This is a great learning experience for any business, finance, mathematics, risk management or economic student looking at building knowledge of the regulatory environment as a lead into a career at OSFI or in the financial industry.
A DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE WORKPLACE

OSFI is committed to having a skilled and diverse workforce representative of the Canadian population. Therefore, consideration may be given to qualified candidates who self-identify as members of one of the following Employment Equity (EE) Groups: Aboriginal peoples, Persons with disabilities, Members of visible minorities and Women. As such, we strongly encourage students who identify within the EE Groups and meet the job requirements of the position being staffed to apply and self-identify in their application.","DUTIES
Financial analysis and/or risk reporting on assigned industries and markets
Surveillance/research of significant risk issues that have an impact on financial institutions
Special projects relating to the collection and organization of financial data
Risk management through data mining/extraction of financial institution submissions and industry information
Providing support with planned or adhoc divisional projects and initiatives
Providing support to the supervisory team which will include monitoring, analysis and reporting
Conducting the deposit-taking institution (DTI) capital model approval and monitoring the model performance through significant activity reviews
Risk management through monitoring and on-site reviews of financial institutions
Researching significant news items/press releases that have an impact on financial institutions
Other duties as required","EXPERIENCE/ SKILLS
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Highly motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to take initiative and find improved ways to conduct a task more efficiently
Sound understanding of financial analysis and financial systems
Experience with big data analytics, data visualization and/or unstructured data would be beneficial
Knowledge of script languages (e.g. Python) and statistical packages (e.g. Matlab, R, SAS) would be an asset
Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with Access/SQL Server, Excel and other analytical software would be an asset.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Role Location: Toronto

column1: Position Description: We are looking for University students pursuing a Computer Science degree who are interested in a 2022 Winter Co-op and that are passionate about building large-scale, mission-critical software in a fast-paced agile environment. The ideal candidate will share our passion and pride in the simple elegance and usability of our solution and will join an engineering team that strongly believes in automated testing, UX design and an iterative process to build high-quality next generation enterprise software.
We offer: High priority projects, great mentors, hackathons and Lunch-n-Learns with Okta leaders.

Our team is fast, innovative and flexible; with a weekly release cycle and individual ownership we expect great things from all of our engineers and reward them with stimulating new projects, emerging technologies and the chance to have significant impact in a company that is changing the cloud computing landscape forever.","Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Analyze/Refine Requirements with Product Owner and Tech Lead
Work with engineering management to scope and plan engineering efforts
Design and implement high-performance, scalable, reusable and maintainable software that will see real-world action
Participate in test-driven development, design and code reviews
Interface with TechOps, Documentation, and Design teams","Minimum Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Interest in software development experience, and testing that supports building highly reliable, mission-critical software.
Ability to program in at least one OO programming language (e.g. Java, JavaScript, C#, C++)
Knowledge of web application frameworks, RDBMS & application servers (experience in one or more preferred)
Reasonable understanding of network security, encryption, authentication and authorization
Academic experience in data structures and algorithms
Ability to apply knowledge gained in computer science courses to real world problems.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Selenium, JQuery
.Net, Windows development and JavaScript a plus
Past summer internship experience, ideally in enterprise software companies
Education and Training: (In progress) BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or related field
Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Olbia Software Inc,Colligo Division,1,Open for Applications,Vancouver,Intermediate, Senior",0,"

column8: ,4 month work term,As a Co-op Business Development Representative you will support our Business Development Team at Colligo and Account Executives on outbound and inbound sales efforts. Working individually and as a team to prospect, qualify, and book discovery meetings for Account Executives with leaders at Small, Medium, and Enterprise companies.

column1: We are seeking self-starters, who learn quickly, are comfortable making 50 or so cold calls a day, and will not tire of often repetitive work that leads to actionable results. We are not your typical software vendor - we have a lean and extremely talented and hard working team, which the individual we hire will be able to learn from and work with on a daily basis. You need to be able to think on your feet, and make connections over the phone or email quickly.
You must understand market dynamics and have keen knowledge and awareness of competitive products, solutions and offerings in the Microsoft Cloud and Microsoft 365 space and ecosystem.

You must be able to represent the Colligo brand in a professional manner, and fit with the positive & and team-oriented culture we've created. Everyone on our team helps us to work toward our vision and truly living our values. This is a remote role with monthly team meet ups (barring pandemic restrictions).","Key Responsibilities
•           Learn and execute proven processes to generate new sales opportunities: i.e. making ~50 calls/day;
•            Strategize with and learn from top-producing sales managers;
•            Map prospective accounts around organizational structure, people and existing technology;
•            Engage executives in targeted prospect accounts;
•            Orchestrate discussions with senior execs around their business needs;
•            Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects;
•            Leverage CRM and marketing automation tools to prospect into specific geographic territories and sectors.","Requirements
•           Undergoing a degree or diploma in a related field;
•            Prior B2B sales experience is a strong asset;
•            Bilingualism in French and English is an asset;
•            A commanding desire to learn and succeed in tech sales;
•            Candidates should have one of the following: software/saas experience, sales experience or other related business experience from prior terms;
•            HubSpot & LinkedIn Sales Navigator experience is an asset;
•            The ability to write succinct, crisp emails and a great phone manner;
•            Knowledge of any of the following industry sectors a plus: multi-channel marketing, content marketing, e-commerce, digital and mobile marketing, B2B and B2C sales;
•            You are comfortable facing rejection and making 50-100 calls/ day.
Behavioral Requirements
•           A desire to do and achieve brilliant things!
•            You love connecting with people;
•            Integrity is fundamentally important to you;
•            You want to make a real difference and change lives;
•            You are naturally entrepreneurial and hard working.","Targeted Clusters

column1: POSITION
Laboratory Associate
LOCATION
Niagara Falls, ON","SUMMARY

The student will be responsible for performing a variety of ASTM and ISO test procedures on a wide range of lubricant and specialty chemical based products This position will grow into the development of new lubricant and specialty chemical products which will also be tested to ASTM  and ISO standards. This position will also require the commissioning and certification of testing equipment. Frequent dialogue with internal and external partners will be required. The student will be directly supervised and mentored by the laboratory manager.","EDUCATION:
University-level Chemistry and/or Chemical Engineering
The applicant must be:
An independent learner
Confident in their knowledge
Able to communicate their findings and results
Able to stay on the task at hand
Analytical and meticulous in their work ethic
Able to solve problems with a hands-on approach
The applicant should have a reasonable amount of organic lab chemistry experience.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Oliver Wyman,North America,3,Open for Applications,Remote in Canada,Senior,17,

column8: ,4 month work term,Why Join Us?

column1: Come aboard if you are excited by challenges and at ease working across cultures. You'll find interesting people who speak their minds and measure success not by how many hours are worked but by what gets accomplished.
Immediate impact, continuous challenge
You'll work on challenging projects that have a meaningful impact on clients, industries, and societies from day one.
We'll ask you to challenge the norm and constantly strive to build something new to shape our firm and the world around us.
You'll be a contributing team member from the start, working with senior colleagues and clients to build trust-based relationships and deliver breakthrough impact.
Your experience will be diverse, with each project offering new opportunities to expand your toolkit and to team with Specialists who have deep subject-matter and technical expertise
You'll have the opportunity to travel frequently; whether this is internationally or in your home-city, no two weeks are ever the same.
Chart your course; we support the journey
This isn't a ""two-year program"" - no artificial barriers stand in the way of your progression.
You'll have the opportunity to work across a wide variety of industries and capabilities and you can decide to specialize early or leave it until several years in.

You'll learn on the job via our apprenticeship model, supplemented by formal training. Much of your initial focus will be on research and analysis, and we'll support you in rapidly developing your communication, presentation, and client-management skills.

We care about you succeeding and you will be supported every step of the way. You will be mentored and coached by colleagues at each stage, from partners and other consultants to a dedicated ""buddy,"" career adviser, and talent manager.

We believe inspired people with interesting lives make better consultants. We care deeply about sustainable work-life quality and provide for career flexibility with a variety of programs including sabbaticals, non-profit fellowships, and externships.
We hire you to be you
Our open, inclusive, and down-to-earth culture will enable you to bring your authentic self to work.
There's no corporate mold to fit and hierarchy doesn't get in the way.
Many of your colleagues will become life-long friends.","The Internship
The Intern Program is an internship for talented, highly motivated rising seniors.  As professional members of our firm:
Work in teams to solve high level business problems facing Fortune 1000 clients
Structure and carry out essential research and data management
Lead complex quantitative, strategic and financial analyses of corporations and businesses
Participate on a project team with significant exposure to senior leadership of the firm
Receive mentorship throughout the program
Participate in a week of training at the beginning of the summer

Receive broad exposure to a variety of industries including: Automotive, Aviation, Communications, Financial Services, Energy, Health & Life Sciences, Media, Retail, Surface Transportation and Technology.","Qualifications

We look for initiative, intuition and creativity with a strong background in problem solving and analytics. We do not require a specific academic major or industry experience and we value extracurricular activities and evidence of leading an interesting and impactful life outside of studies/work. One of the best things we can do for our clients and ourselves is to recruit a diverse group of people who bring a broad range of strengths and backgrounds to their roles.","Targeted Clusters
